SOURCE DEFINITION: Marine brine pools are large areas of brine on the ocean basin. These pools are bodies of water that have a salinity three to five times greater than the surrounding ocean. For deep-sea brine pools the source of the salt is the dissolution of large salt deposits through salt tectonics. The brine often contains high concentrations of methane, providing energy to chemosynthetic animals that live near the pool.

label: tuya
definition: A distinctive, flat-topped, steep-sided volcano formed when lava erupts through a thick glacier or ice sheet.

label: complex volcano
definition: A volcano with more than one feature. They form because changes of their eruptive characteristics or the location of multiple vents in an area. Stratovolcanoes may form complex volcanoes, because they may overlap another from explosive eruptions, lava flows, pyroclastic flows and by repeated eruptions, to make multiple summits and vents. Stratovolcanoes could also form a large caldera that gets filled in by multiple small cinder cones, lava domes and craters may also develop on the caldera's rim.

label: pyroclastic shield volcano
definition: A shield volcano that is formed mostly of pyroclastic and highly explosive eruptions rather than relatively fluid basaltic lava issuing from vents or fissures on the surface of the volcano. They typically display low-angle flank slopes and have little or no central collapse, although a shallow sag in the shield is commonly observed. Lava is commonly extruded after the cessation of explosive activity commonly superposes the vent region.

label: artificial lake
definition: A lake purposefully constructed.

label: canal head reservoir
definition: A reservoir constructed for the purpose of maintaining water levels in a canal or canals.

label: ice shelf
definition: An ice mass which 1) is attached to the coast 2) at least 2 meters in thickness 3) forms where a glacier or ice mass flows down to a coastline and onto the ocean surface and 4) grows by annual snow accumulation or by the seaward extension of land glaciers.

label: massif
definition: A section of the Earths's crust that is demarcated by faults or flexures. In the movement of the crust, a massif tends to retain its internal structure while being displaced as a whole.

label: lake shore
definition: That part of the land in immediate contact with a lake.

label: stream bed
SYNONYMS: dry stream bed|stream bottom|stream channel|stream channel
definition: The channel bottom of a stream; the physical confine of the normal water flow.

label: river bed
definition: The channel bottom of a river; the physical confine of the normal water flow.

label: stream mouth
definition: The place where a stream discharges into a lagoon, lake, or the sea.

label: river mouth
definition: The end of a stream where it enters a standing water body such as a lake, sea or ocean.

label: container of an intermittent lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: container of an intermittent water body
definition: A depression which intermittently contains a lake.

label: mountain spur
definition: A spur which is part of a mountain.

label: land bridge
definition: An isthmus or other land connection between what at other times are separate land masses which allows animals and plants to cross and colonise new lands. Land bridges are commonly created by regression, in which sea levels fall exposing previously submerged sections of continental shelf. Land bridges are also formed by: (a) upthrust at the edge of continental plates; and (b) glacial retreat alleviating pressure on shallow marine formations.

label: ice tongue
definition: A long and narrow sheet of ice projecting out from the coastline. An ice tongue forms when a valley glacier moves very rapidly out into the ocean or a lake.

label: sound
definition: A large sea or ocean inlet larger than a bay, deeper than a bight, wider than a fjord, or it may identify a narrow sea or ocean channel between two bodies of land.

label: strait
definition: A narrow channel of water that connects two larger bodies of water, and thus lies between two land masses.

label: channel of a watercourse
definition: A depressed landform which physically confines a river, slough or ocean strait, and which consists of a bed and banks.

label: marine channel
definition: A channel of a watercourse which contains marine water.

label: lake channel
definition: A channel of a watercourse which contains lake water.

label: volcanic cone
definition: Built by fragments (called ejecta) thrown up (ejected) from a volcanic vent, piling up around the vent in the shape of a cone with a central crater.

label: ash cone
definition: A cone that is composed of particles of silt to sand size. Explosive eruptions from a vent where the magma is interacting with groundwater or the sea (as in an eruption off the coast) produce steam and are called phreatic. The interaction between the magma, expanding steam, and volcanic gases results in the ejection of mostly small particles called ash. Fallen ash has the consistency of flour. The unconsolidated ash forms an ash cone which becomes a tuff cone or tuff ring once the ash consolidates.

label: cinder cone
definition: A cone built almost entirely of loose volcanic fragments called cinders (pumice, pyroclastics, or tephra). They are built from particles and blobs of congealed lava ejected from a single vent. As the gas-charged lava is blown violently into the air, it breaks into small fragments that solidify and fall as cinders around the vent to form a circular or oval cone. Most cinder cones have a bowl-shaped crater at the summit.

label: spatter cone
definition: A volcanic cone formed of molten lava ejected from a vent somewhat like taffy. Expanding gases in the lava fountains tear the liquid rock into irregular gobs that fall back to earth, forming a heap around the vent. The still partly liquid rock splashed down and over the sides of the developing mound is called spatter. Because spatter is not fully solid when it lands, the individual deposits are very irregular in shape and weld together as they cool, and in this way particularly differ from cinder and ash.

label: mud volcano
definition: A volcano created by geologically excreted liquids and gases, although there are several different processes which may cause such activity. Temperatures are much cooler than igneous processes.

label: shield volcano
definition: A large volcano with shallowly-sloping sides.

label: stratovolcano
definition: A tall, conical volcano composed of many layers of hardened lava, tephra, and volcanic ash. These volcanoes are characterized by a steep profile and periodic, explosive eruptions. The lava that flows from them is viscous, and cools and hardens before spreading very far. The source magma of this rock is classified as acidic, or high in silica to intermediate (rhyolite, dacite, or andesite).

label: mid-ocean ridge
definition: An underwater mountain range, formed by plate tectonics. This uplifting of the ocean floor occurs when convection currents rise in the mantle beneath the oceanic crust and create magma where two tectonic plates meet at a divergent boundary. The mid-ocean ridges of the world are connected and form a single global mid-oceanic ridge system that is part of every ocean.

label: subglacial volcano
definition: A volcano produced by subglacial eruptions or eruptions beneath the surface of a lake melted into a glacier or ice mass by the rising lava.

label: volcanic fissure
definition: A linear volcanic vent through which lava erupts, usually without any explosive activity. The vent is usually a few meters wide and may be many kilometers long. Fissure vents can cause large flood basalts and hannels. The volcano can usually be seen as a crack in the ground or on the ocean floor. Narrow fissures can be filled in with lava that hardens.

label: whirlpool
definition: A large, swirling body of water produced by ocean tides.

label: kipuka
definition: An elevated area such as a hill, ridge or old lava dome inside or downslope from an area of active volcanism. New lava flows will cover the surrounding land, isolating the kipuka so that it appears as a (usually) forested island in a barren lava flow.

label: ford
definition: The shallow part of a stream which can be easily crossed.

label: tidal watercourse
definition: A watercourse which has the intensity and direction of its flow primarily determined by the tides.

label: pingo
definition: A mound of earth-covered ice found in the Arctic, subarctic, and Antarctica that can reach up to 70 metres in height and up to 2 kilometres in diameter.

label: natural arch
definition: A natural formation where a rock arch forms, with a natural passageway through underneath.

label: raised beach
definition: A beach or wave cut platform raised above the shore line by a relative fall in the sea level.

label: coastal dune
definition: A dune which is part of a coast.

label: machair
definition: A fertile low-lying raised beach found on the some of the coastlines of Ireland and Scotland, in particular in the Outer Hebrides.

label: ria
definition: A submergent coastal landform that forms where sea levels rise relative to the land either as a result of eustatic sea level change; where the global sea levels rise or isostatic sea level change; where the land sinks. When this happens valleys which were previously at sea level become submerged.

label: stack
definition: A geological landform consisting of a steep and often vertical column or columns of rock in the sea near a coast.

label: tombolo
definition: A deposition landform such as a spit or bar which forms a narrow piece of land between an island or offshore rock and a mainland shore, or between two islands or offshore rocks. They usually form because the island causes wave refraction, depositing sand and shingle moved by longshore drift in each direction around the island where the waves meet. Eustatic sea level rise may also contribute to accretion as material is pushed up with rising sea levels.

label: wave-cut platform
definition: The narrow flat area often seen at the base of a sea cliff caused by the action of the waves.

label: limestone pavement
definition: A natural karst landform consisting of a flat, incised surface of exposed limestone that resembles artificial pavement.

label: river island
definition: An island that lies in a river.

label: lake island
definition: An island that lies in a lake.

label: ocean floor
definition: A marine bed which lies below an ocean.

label: meander
definition: A bend in a stream. A stream flowing through a wide valley or flat plain will tend to form a meanders as it alternatively erodes and deposits sediments along its course.

label: biome
definition: A biome is an ecosystem which is undergoing climactic ecological succession.

label: arete
definition: A ridge which is jagged, narrow and separates glacier valleys or cirques.

label: dirt cone
definition: A feature of a glacier, in which dirt, which has fallen into a hollow in the ice, forms a coating which insulates the ice below. The surrounding ice melts away, leaving the dirt cone.

label: drumlin field
definition: A cluster of dozens to hundreds of similarly shaped, sized and oriented drumlins.

label: monadnock
definition: An isolated hill, knob, ridge, or small mountain that rises abruptly from a gently sloping or virtually level surrounding plain.

label: kame terrace
definition: A terrace associated with a kame.

label: outwash fan
definition: A fan-shaped body of sediments deposited by braided streams from a melting glacier.

label: proglacial lake
definition: A lake formed either by the damming action of a moraine or ice dam during the retreat of a melting glacier, or one formed by meltwater trapped against an ice mass due to isostatic depression of the crust around the ice.

label: tunnel valley
definition: A deep but narrow valley with a 'U' shaped cross-section and frequently a 'U' shaped plan which is usually found filled with glacial till. It is formed when the edge of an ice mass advances up a slope. Its length may be appropriately measured in centimetres or kilometres, depending on the circumstances of formation.

label: Nye channel
definition: A small tunnel valley.

label: alas
definition: A steep-sided depression formed by the melting of permafrost; it may contain a lake.

label: dell
definition: A small wooded valley, either U- or V-shaped.

label: rock shelter
definition: A shallow cave-like opening at the base of a bluff or cliff.

label: terracette
definition: A ridge on a hillside formed when saturated soil particles expand, then contract as they dry, causing them to move slowly downhill.

label: maelstrom
definition: A very powerful whirlpool.

label: flood control reservoir
definition: A reservoir constructed for the purpose of containing a flood, an overflow of water from a body of water that sumerges land.

label: woodland clearing
SYNONYMS: CLEARING|burn|burnt over area|clearing|clearing|cut line|fire break|forest clearing|glade|grassland|logged area|opening
definition: A tract of land which has few or no trees and is surrounded by more heavily wooded areas.

label: transvasement
definition: An aquaduct to transport water from one river basin to another one, to solve problems of hydrographic imbalance. It can decrease floods, moving the water to lands with droughts.

label: terrestrial biome
definition: A biome which is  primarily or completely situated on a landmass.

label: marine biome
definition: An aquatic biome which is determined by a marine water body.

label: hydroelectric reservoir
definition: A reservoir constructed for the purpose of generating electricity.

label: drinking water reservoir
definition: A reservoir constructed for the purpose of providing drinking water.

label: irrigation reservoir
definition: A reservoir constructed for the purpose of providing water for irrigation.

label: amenity lake
definition: A lake constructed, or modified, for the chief purpose of providing an amenity.

label: ribbon lake
definition: A lake that is long, narrow, and finger-shaped, usually found in a glacial trough. Its formation begins when a glacier moves over an area containing alternate bands of hard and soft bedrock. The sharp-edged boulders carried at the bottom of the glacier erode the softer rock more quickly by abrasion, thus creating a hollow called a rock basin. On either side of the rock basin, the more resistant rock is eroded less and these outcrops of harder rock are known as rock bars, which act as dams between which rainwater may accumulate after the retreat of the ice age, filling up the rock basin and creating a ribbon lake. A ribbon lake may also form behind a terminal or recessional moraine, both of which also act as dams, enabling water to accumulate behind them. A ribbon lake may also occur if a tributary glacier joins a main glacier. The increase in power can create a trough, which is filled with water from a river/meltwater to create a ribbon lake.

label: liman
definition: A lake or estuary that is formed at the mouth of a river where flow is blocked by a bar of sediments. It can be maritime (the bar being created by the current of a sea) or fluvial (the bar being created by the flow of a bigger river at the confluence).

label: turlough
definition: A container of an intermittent lake unique to the limestone areas of Ireland, mostly west of the River Shannon. Most turloughs flood in the autumn, usually some time in October, and then dry up some time between April and July.

label: tarn
definition: A mountain lake that is formed in a cirque excavated by a glacier. A moraine may form a natural dam below a tarn.

label: penplain
definition: A region of low topographic relief as a consequence of erosion by streams.

label: pseudocrater
definition: A volcanic landform which resembles a true volcanic crater, but differs in that it is not an actual vent from which lava has erupted. A pseudocrater is characterised by the absence of any magma conduit which connects below the surface of the earth. Pseudocraters are formed by steam explosions as flowing hot lava crosses over a wet surface, such as a swamp, a lake, or a pond. The explosive gases break through the lava surface in a manner similar to a phreatic eruption, and the tephra builds up crater-like forms which can appear very similar to real volcanic craters.

label: polygenetic volcanic field
definition: A volcanic field of scattered volcanic vents. These volcanic fields, containing numerous polygenetic volcanoes, are noted for having more than one eruptive event from the same vent(s), rather than the more common monogenetic volcanic field. Polygenetic volcanic fields generally occur where there is a high-level magma chamber. These volcanic fields may show lithological discontinuities due to major changes in magma chemistry, volcanotectonic events, or long erosional intervals, and may last >10 million year period.

label: harbour
definition: A landform which provides shelter from atmospheric weather and marine currents, waves, and other dynamics.

label: artificial harbor
definition: A harbor constructed by human agency.

label: natural harbor
definition: A harbor which is formed by a natural landform where a part of a body of water is protected and deep enough to furnish anchorage.

label: university campus
definition: An area of land on which a college or university and related institutional buildings are situated.

label: hydroelectric dam
definition: A dam constructed for the purpose of generating electricity from the water stored behind it.

label: research facility
definition: A facility, permanent or temporary, on land, in air, space or water, where scientific research or measurements can be undertaken.

label: irrigation dam
definition: A dam constructed for the purpose of holding water in a reservoir for irrigation.

label: flood control dam
definition: A dam constructed for the purpose of controlling flooding.

label: backwater
definition: An area of calm water unaffected by the current of a stream.

label: gravel pit
definition: A quarry from which gravel is extracted.

label: cut
definition: An excavation of the Earth's surface to provide passage for a road, railway, canal, etc.

label: inlet
definition: An opening of the sea into the land, or of a lake into its shore.

label: lake inlet
definition: An opening of a lake into its shore.

label: mount
definition: A mountain or a hill.

label: range of mounts
definition: A field which includes at least two mounts connected by high ground and arranged in an approximately linear fashion.

label: mouth
definition: The exit or point of discharge of a stream into another stream, lake or sea.

label: peak
definition: The summit of a mount.

label: pinnacle
definition: A tall, slender, spire-shaped rock projecting from a level or more gently sloping surface.

label: sea floor
SYNONYMS: Meeresboden|SeaFloor|fondale marino|fondo marino|ocean floor|ocean floor|sea bed|seabed|seafloor||
definition: A marine bed which lies below a sea.

label: plunge pool
definition: A hollow eroded by the force of the falling water at the base of a waterfall, particularly by the eddying effect.

label: polynya
definition: A sea surface layer which is 1) not covered by ice and 2) laterally surrounded by either pack ice or land and pack ice.

label: sea shore
definition: That part of the land in immediate contact with a sea, including the intertidal zone.

label: paternoster lake
definition: One of a series of glacial lakes connected by a single stream or a braided stream system.

label: glacial lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of glacial meltwater and which fills a depression formed as a result of a glacial erosion process.

label: palsa
definition: A frost heave which is formed as the result of a perennial ice lens forming under soil, pushing a roughly oval portion land surface upwards.

label: consequent stream
definition: A stream whose course is a direct consequence of the original slope of the surface upon which it developed, i.e., a stream that follows the slope of the original land.

label: subsequent stream
definition: A stream whose course has been determined by selective headward erosion along weak strata. These streams have generally developed after the original stream. Subsequent streams developed independently of the original relief of the land and generally follow paths determined by the weak rock belts.

label: resequent stream
definition: A stream whose course follows the original relief, but at a lower level than the original slope (e.g., flows down a course determined by the underlying strata in the same direction). These streams develop later and are generally a tributary to a subsequent stream.

label: obsequent stream
definition: A stream flowing in the opposite direction of the consequent drainage.

label: insequent stream
definition: A stream that has an almost random drainage often forming dendritic patterns. These are typically tributaries and have developed by a headward erosion on a horizontally stratified belt or on homogeneous rocks. These streams follow courses that apparently were not controlled by the original slope of the surface, its structure or the type of rock.

label: tributary
definition: A stream or river which flows into another river (a parent river) or body of water but which may not flow directly into the sea.

label: rill
definition: A narrow and shallow incision into soil resulting from erosion by overland flow that has been focused into a thin thread by soil surface roughness. Rilling, the process of rill formation, is common on agricultural land and unvegetated ground.

label: rincon
definition: An incised meander on a river.

label: volcanic dike
definition: An intrusive igneous body. Its thickness is usually much smaller than its other two dimensions. Thickness can vary from sub-centimeter scale to many meters in thickness and the lateral dimensions can extend over many kilometers. A dike is an intrusion into a cross-cutting fissure, meaning a dike cuts across other pre-existing layers or bodies of rock, this means that a dike is always younger than the rocks that contain it. Dikes are usually high angle to near vertical in orientation, but subsequent tectonic deformation may rotate the sequence of strata through which the dike lies so that the latter becomes horizontal.

label: trough
definition: A linear structural depression that extends laterally over a distance, while being less steep than a trench. A trough can be a narrow basin or a geologic rift. There are various oceanic troughs, troughs found under oceans; examples include the rift along the mid-oceanic ridge and the Cayman Trough.

label: submerged bed
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: The portion of the ground surface which lies below water.

label: container of an intermittent saline lake
SYNONYMS: intermittent saline lake|intermittent salt lake|intermittent salt lakes|lake
definition: A depression that is periodically filled with saline water, forming a saline lake.

label: container of an intermittent oxbow lake
subClassOf [LABEL]: container of an intermittent lake|oxbow lake
definition: A depression which is continous with one or more abandoned meander loops of a river channel.

label: container of an intermittent pond
subClassOf [LABEL]: container of an intermittent water body
SYNONYMS: intermittent pond|intermittent ponds|intermittent pool|intermittent pool|intermittent pool
definition: A container of an intermittent water body which, when filled with water, has a well-illuminated surface layer, is subject to complete mixing of the water it holds, and is smaller than the container of a lake.

label: underground irrigation canal
definition: A gently inclined underground tunnel bringing water for irrigation from an aquifer.

label: intermittently filled reservoir
subClassOf [LABEL]: container of an intermittent water body
definition: A reservoir that is not permanently filled with water, at times being dry.

label: wadi mouth
definition: The lower terminus of a wadi where it widens into an adjoining floodplain, depression, or water body.

label: terrace
definition: A step-like feature between higher and lower ground: a relatively flat or gently inclined shelf of earth, backed and fronted by steep slopes or manmade detaining walls.

label: marine terrace
definition: A terrace which is located in a marine water body.

label: meander neck
definition: A landform which is the narrowest part of a meander.

label: pond bed
definition: The ground surface that lies beneath a pond.

label: reservoir bed
definition: The ground surface that lies beneath a reservoir.

label: crater
definition: A generally circular saucer or bowl-shaped depression caused by explosive action.

label: road cut
definition: A cut to provide passage for a road.

label: hummock
definition: A patch of ground, distinct from and slightly above the surrounding plain or wetland. Often occurs in groups.

label: lost stream
SYNONYMS: lost river|lost river|lost river|lost watercourse|lost watercourse|stream
definition: A surface stream that disappears into an underground channel, or dries up in an arid area.

label: ditch mouth
definition: The exit or point of discharge of a ditch.

label: agricultural terrace
definition: A terrace which is used for agricultural activities.

label: landslide
definition: A mound of earth material, at the base of a slope and the associated scoured area.

label: rockfall
definition: An irregular mass of fallen rock at the base of a cliff or steep slope.

label: canal tunnel
definition: A tunnel through which a canal passes.

label: cutoff
definition: A channel formed as a result of a stream cutting through a meander neck.

label: abandoned watercourse
definition: A former stream or distributary no longer carrying flowing water, but still evident due to lakes, wetland, topographic or vegetation patterns.

label: canalized stream
definition: A stream that has been substantially ditched, diked, or straightened.

label: cliff cleft
definition: A deep narrow slot, notch, or groove in a cliff.

label: interfluve
definition: A relatively undissected upland between adjacent stream valleys.

label: ice cap ridge
definition: A linear elevation on an icecap.

label: beach ridge
definition: A ridge of sand just inland and parallel to the beach, usually in series.

label: apron
definition: A gentle slope, with a generally smooth surface, particularly found around groups of islands and seamounts.

label: ice cap depression
definition: A depression which is part of an ice cap.

label: landfill
definition: A depression which contains objects and materials discarded by humans or their technologies.

label: riverine pothole
SYNONYMS: churn hole|eddy mill|evorsion|giant's kettle|kettle|kolk|pot|rock mill|stream kettle|swirlhole

label: weir
definition: A low obstruction built across the path of s stream to raise its level.

label: moatan
definition: An annular depression that may not be continuous, located at the base of many seamounts, islands, and other isolated elevations.

label: boulder field
definition: A high altitude or high latitude bare, flat area covered with large angular rocks.

label: arrugado
definition: An undersea area of subdued corrugations.

label: geographic sill
definition: The low part of a gap or saddle separating basins.

label: brackish lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of brackish water, having a higher salinity than fresh water but a lower salinity than marine water.

label: brackish pond
definition: A pond which is composed primarily of brackish water.

label: kame
definition: An irregularly shaped hill or mound composed of sorted or stratified sand and gravel that is deposited in contact with the glacial ice. It can have an irregular shape. Kames are often associated with kettles, and this is referred to as kame and kettle topography. When the ice retreats further, the delta kame often collapses. Kame terraces are frequently found along the side of a glacial valley and are the deposits of meltwater streams flowing between the ice and the adjacent valley side.

label: swale
definition: A depression which comprises a low tract of land, especially when moist or marshy.

label: leat
definition: A man-made watercourse, or makeshift aqueduct, often an artificial channel which supplies water to a watermill or its mill pond, collecting water from upstream of the mill so that the natural level of the driving water is above the level of the stream at the mill. Alternatively to may deliver water for mineral washing and concentration, irrigation or to a dye works.

label: shingle beach
definition: A beach which is armoured with pebbles or small to medium sized cobbles.

label: waterhole
definition: A pond, often temporary or seasonal, used as a drinking place by mammals and birds.

label: gravel field
definition: A field which is composed primarily of gravel.

label: container of an intermittent water body
SYNONYMS: intermittent body of water|intermittent water body
definition: A depression which is is periodically filled with water when water supply exceeds evapotranspiration and bed seepage.

label: range of seamounts
SYNONYMS: cordillera|seamount chain|seamount group|seamount range|undersea cordillera|undersea mountain chain|undersea range
definition: A mountain range which is submerged under a marine water body.

label: endorheic basin
definition: A drainage basin from which there is no outflow of water, either on the surface as rivers, or underground by flow or diffusion through rock or permeable material.

label: talik
definition: An area of unfrozen ground surrounded by permafrost.

label: multipurpose dam
definition: A dam constructed for more than one purpose.

label: saddle dam
definition: An auxiliary dam constructed to confine the reservoir created by a primary dam either to permit a higher water elevation and storage or to limit the extent of a reservoir for increased efficiency.

label: check dam
definition: A dam designed to reduce flow velocity and control soil erosion.

label: wing dam
definition: A dam that only partly restricts a waterway, creating a faster channel that resists the accumulation of sediment.

label: dry dam
definition: A dam designed to control flooding. It normally holds back no water and allows the channel to flow freely, except during periods of intense flow that would otherwise cause flooding downstream.

label: diversionary dam
definition: A dam designed to divert all or a portion of the flow of a river from its natural course.

label: weapons test site
definition: A region at which weapons, typically military, are tested.

label: nuclear weapons test site
definition: A weapons test site at which nuclear weapons are, or have been, tested.

label: military training area
definition: A region in which military personnel train.

label: park
definition: A bounded area of land, or water, usually in its natural or semi-natural (landscaped) state and set aside for some purpose, usually to do with recreation or conservation.

label: pier
definition: A raised walkway over water, supported by piles or pillars.

label: sports facility
definition: A building or region where sports activities can be carried out.

label: winter sports facility
definition: A sports facility constructed for skiing and allied sports that require snow and/or ice.

label: calanque
definition: A deep valley with steep sides, typically of limestone, in part submerged by the sea.

label: city
definition: Incorporated populated place.

label: freshwater biome
definition: An aquatic biome which is determined by a body of freshwater.

label: large river biome
definition: A freshwater river biome which is determined by a large river.

label: large river headwater biome
definition: A freshwater river biome which is determined by the headwaters of a large river.

label: large river delta biome
definition: A freshwater river biome which is determined by the delta of a large river.

label: small river biome
definition: A freshwater river biome which is determined by a small river.

label: large freshwater lake biome
definition: A freshwater biome which is determined by a large lake.

label: small freshwater lake biome
definition: A freshwater lake biome which is determined by a small lake.

label: xeric basin biome
definition: A biome which has little permanent surface water and a low relative abundance of springs.

label: mine drainage
SYNONYMS: acid and metalliferous drainage|acid rock drainage
definition: The outflow of water from a mine.

label: acid mine drainage
definition: A mine drainage with an acidic pH.

label: soil
definition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, interstitial gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.

label: marine water body
definition: A lentic water body which is composed primarily of marine water.

label: slope
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the planetary surface between the peak of an elevation or the bottom of a depression and relatively flat surrounding land.

label: aquatic biome
definition: A biome which is determined by a water body and which has ecological climax communities adapted to life in or on water.

label: oil spill
definition: The result of the unintentional release of liquid petroleum hydrocarbon into the environment as a result of human activity.

label: oil seep
definition: The result of the release of natural hydrocarbons to the surface of the earth, including beneath the sea, by natural geological processes.

label: gold mine drainage
definition: Mine drainage which is formed as a result of the mining of gold.

label: contaminated soil
definition: A portion of contaminated soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of some contaminant.

label: creosote contaminated soil
definition: Soil which has elevated concentrations of creosote.

label: alkaline hot spring
definition: A alkaline spring through which groundwater, heated by geothermal energy, flows.

label: acidic hot spring
definition: An acidic spring through which groundwater, heated by geothermal energy, flows.

label: alkaline salt lake
definition: A saline lake which has a high pH.

label: mesophilic sulfur spring
definition: A sulfur spring through which water at a temperature optimal for the growth of mesophillic microorganism (approximately 20 to 45 degrees Celsius) flows.

label: hypolimnion
definition: The dense, bottom layer of water in a thermally-stratified lake. It is the layer that lies below the thermocline.

label: epilimnion
definition: The top-most layer in a thermally stratified lake, occurring above the deeper hypolimnion. It is warmer and typically has a higher pH and dissolved oxygen concentration than the hypolimnion.

label: metalimnion
definition: A cline which is part of a lake and across which temperature changes rapidly with depth.

label: brackish estuary
definition: An estuary which is composed primarily of brackish water.

label: calcite hot spring
definition: A calcic spring through which groundwater, heated by geothermal energy, flows.

label: cave wall
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A solid surface layer which 1)  forms part of the boundary between the cavity of a cave and its solid container and 2) is roughtly perpendicular to the cave floor.

label: chromate contaminated soil
definition: Soil which has elevated concentrations of chromate.

label: xylene contaminated soil
definition: Soil which has elevated concentrations of xylene.

label: estuarine mud
definition: Mud which is part of an estuary.

label: hospital
definition: A hospital is a building in which health care services are  provided by specialized staff and equipment.

label: neutral hot spring
definition: A neutral spring through which groundwater, heated by geothermal energy, flows.

label: oil reservoir
definition: A subsurface landform which contains fluid hydrocarbons in porous or fractured rock formations.

label: pyritic acid mine drainage
SYNONYMS: Acid mine drainage which has elevated levels of pyritic acid.

label: sandy beach
definition: A beach which is primarily composed of sand.

label: anthropogenic contamination feature
definition: An anthropogenic geographic feature which has increased levels of contaminants in its consituent materials.

label: unexploded-ordnance dump
definition: A dump which contains ammunition, or other material intended for use during combat, that still has the potential to explode.

label: power plant
definition: A power plant is a building which contains one or more generators which convert mechanical energy into electrical energy through the relative motion between a magnetic field and a conductor. The energy source harnessed to turn the generator varies widely.

label: geothermal power plant
definition: A geothermal power plant is a power plant which uses heat generated by the decay of radioactive isotopes in the Earth's mantle and crust as well as primordial heat left over from the formation of the Earth to drive its generators.

label: shop
definition: A building in which a business presents a selection of goods and offers to trade or sell them to customers for money or other goods.

label: food shop
definition: A shop in which a business offers food products for sale or trade.

label: borehole
definition: A channel which is constructed by removing materials from land or submerged beds.

label: arenosol
definition: Arenosols are sandy soils, including both soils developed in residual sands after in situ weathering of usually quartz-rich sediments or rock, and soils developed in recently deposited sands such as dunes in deserts and beach lands.

label: anthrosol
definition: Anthrosols comprise soils that have been modified profoundly through human activities, such as addition of organic materials or household wastes, irrigation and cultivation.

label: alisol
definition: Alisols are soils that have a higher clay content in the subsoil than in the topsoil as a result of pedogenetic processes (especially clay migration) leading to an argic subsoil horizon. Alisols have a low base saturation at certain depths and high-activity clays throughout the argic horizon. They lack the albeluvic tonguing as in Albeluvisols. They occur predominantly in humid tropical, humid subtropical and warm temperate regions.

label: andosol
definition: Andosols are soils that develop in volcanic ejecta or glasses under almost any climate (except under hyperarid climate conditions). However, Andosols may also develop in other silicate-rich materials under acid weathering in humid and perhumid climates.

label: albeluvisol
definition: Albeluvisols are soils that have, beginning within 1 m of the soil surface, a clay illuviation horizon with an irregular or broken upper boundary resulting in tonguing of bleached soil material into the illuviation horizon.

label: acrisol
definition: Acrisols are soils that have a higher clay content in the subsoil than in the topsoil as a result of pedogenetic processes (especially clay migration) leading to an argic subsoil horizon. Acrisols have in certain depths a low base saturation and low-activity clays.

label: cambisol
definition: Cambisols combine soils with at least an incipient subsurface soil formation. Transformation of parent material is evident from structure formation and mostly brownish discoloration, increasing clay percentage, and/or carbonate removal.

label: cryosol
definition: Cryosols comprise mineral soils formed in a permafrost environment. Where water is present, it occurs primarily in the form of ice. Cryogenic processes are the dominant soil-forming processes.

label: chernozem
definition: Chernozems are soils with a thick black surface layer that is rich in organic matter.

label: durisol
definition: Durisols are associated mainly with old surfaces in arid and semi-arid environments and accommodate very shallow to moderately deep, moderately well- to well-drained soils that contain cemented secondary silica (SiO2) within 100 cm of the soil surface.

label: calcisol
definition: Calcisols are soils in which there is substantial secondary accumulation of lime. Calcisols are common in highly calcareous parent materials and widespread in arid and semi-arid environments.

label: kastanozem
definition: Kastanozems are dry grassland soils, among them the zonal soils of the short-grass steppe belt, south of the Eurasian tall-grass steppe belt with Chernozems. Kastanozems have a similar profile to that of Chernozems but the humus-rich surface horizon is thinner and not as dark as that of the Chernozems and they show more prominent accumulation of secondary carbonates.

label: leptosol
definition: Leptosols are very shallow soils over continuous rock and soils that are extremely gravelly and/or stony. Leptosols are azonal soils and particularly common in mountainous regions.

label: lixisol
definition: Lixisols are soils that have a higher clay content in the subsoil than in the topsoil as a result of pedogenetic processes (especially clay migration) leading to an argic subsoil horizon. Lixisols have a high base saturation and low-activity clays at certain depths.

label: histosol
definition: Histosols comprise soils formed in organic material. These vary from soils developed in predominantly moss peat in boreal, arctic and subarctic regions, via moss peat, reeds/ sedge peat (fen) and forest peat in temperate regions to mangrove peat and swamp forest peat in the humid tropics. Histosols are found at all altitudes, but the vast majority occurs in lowlands.

label: gleysol
definition: Gleysols are wetland soils that, unless drained, are saturated with groundwater for long enough periods to develop a characteristic gleyic colour pattern. This pattern is essentially made up of reddish, brownish or yellowish colours at ped surfaces and/or in the upper soil layer or layers, in combination with greyish/bluish colours inside the peds and/or deeper in the soil.

label: gypsisol
definition: Gypsisols are soils with substantial secondary accumulation of gypsum (calcium sulfate). These soils are found in the driest parts of the arid climate zone.

label: ferralsol
definition: Ferralsols represent the classical, deeply weathered, red or yellow soils of the humid tropics. These soils have diffuse horizon boundaries, a clay assemblage dominated by low-activity clays (mainly kaolinite) and a high content of sesquioxides.

label: nitisol
definition: Nitisols are deep, well-drained, red, tropical soils with diffuse horizon boundaries and a subsurface horizon with more than 30 percent clay and moderate to strong angular blocky structure elements that easily fall apart into characteristic shiny, polyhedric (nutty) elements. Weathering is relatively advanced but Nitisols are far more productive than most other red, tropical soils.

label: luvisol
definition: Luvisols are soils that have a higher clay content in the subsoil than in the topsoil as a result of pedogenetic processes (especially clay migration) leading to an argic subsoil horizon. Luvisols have high-activity clays throughout the argic horizon and a high base saturation at certain depths.

label: phaeozem
definition: Phaeozems accommodate soils of relatively wet grassland and forest regions in moderately continental climates. Phaeozems are much like Chernozems and Kastanozems but are leached more intensively. Consequently, they have dark, humus rich surface horizons that, in comparison with Chernozems and Kastanozems, are less rich in bases. Phaeozems may or may not have secondary carbonates but have a high base saturation in the upper metre of the soil.

label: plinthosol
definition: Plinthosols are soils with plinthite, petroplinthite or pisoliths. Plinthite is an Fe-rich (in some cases also Mn-rich), humus-poor mixture of kaolinitic clay (and other products of strong weathering such as gibbsite) with quartz and other constituents that changes irreversibly to a layer with hard nodules, a hardpan or irregular aggregates on exposure to repeated wetting and drying. Petroplinthite is a continuous, fractured or broken sheet of connected, strongly cemented to indurated nodules or mottles. Pisoliths are discrete strongly cemented to indurated nodules. Both petroplinthite and pisoliths develop from plinthite by hardening.

label: planosol
definition: Planosols are soils with a light-coloured, surface horizon that shows signs of periodic water stagnation and abruptly overlies a dense, slowly permeable subsoil with significantly more clay than the surface horizon.

label: solonchak
definition: Solonchaks are soils that have a high concentration of soluble salts at some time in the year. Solonchaks are largely confined to the arid and semi-arid climate zones and to coastal regions in all climates.

label: umbrisol
definition: Umbrisols are soils in which organic matter has accumulated within the mineral surface soil (in most cases with low base saturation) to the extent that it significantly affects the behaviour and utilization of the soil.

label: vertisol
definition: A soil in which there is a high content of expansive clay known as montmorillonite that forms deep cracks in drier seasons or years. Alternate shrinking and swelling causes self-mulching, where the soil material consistently mixes itself, causing vertisols to have an extremely deep A horizon and no B horizon.

label: solonetz
definition: Solonetz are soils with a dense, strongly structured, clayey subsurface horizon that has a high proportion of adsorbed Na and/or Mg ions. Solonetz that contain free soda (Na2CO3) are strongly alkaline (field pH > 8.5).

label: regosol
definition: Regosols form a taxonomic remnant group containing all soils that could not be accommodated in any of the other RSGs. In practice, Regosols are very weakly developed mineral soils in unconsolidated materials that do not have a mollic or umbric horizon, are not very shallow or very rich in gravels (Leptosols), sandy (Arenosols) or with fluvic materials (Fluvisols). Regosols are extensive in eroding lands, particularly in arid and semi-arid areas and in mountainous terrain.

label: podzol
definition: Podzols are soils with a typically ash-grey upper subsurface horizon, bleached by loss of organic matter and iron oxides, on top of a dark accumulation horizon with brown, reddish or black illuviated humus and/or reddish Fe compounds. Podzols occur in humid areas in the boreal and temperate zones and locally also in the tropics.

label: loam
definition: A soil which is composed of approximately equal proportions of sand and silt, with a smaller proportion of clay.

label: agricultural soil
definition: Soil which is part of an ecosystem used for agricultural activities.

label: dune soil
definition: Soil which is part of some dune.

label: forest soil
definition: A portion of soil which is found in a forested area.

label: clay soil
definition: Soil which is primarily composed of clay.

label: garden soil
definition: A portion of soil which is found in a garden.

label: nuclear power plant
definition: A nuclear power plant is a power plant which uses heat generated by a radioactive decay in a nuclear reactor to convert water into steam in order to drive turbines in electrical generators through pressure.

label: fluvisol
definition: Fluvisols accommodate genetically young, azonal soils in alluvial deposits.

label: stagnosol
definition: Stagnosols are soils with a perched water table showing redoximorphic features caused by surface water. Stagnosols are periodically wet and mottled in the topsoil and subsoil, with or without concretions and/or bleaching.

label: technosol
definition: Technosols are soils whose properties and pedogenesis are dominated by their technical origin. They contain a significant amount of artefacts (something in the soil recognizably made or extracted from the earth by humans), or are sealed by technic hard rock (material created by humans, having properties unlike natural rock). They include soils from wastes (landfills, sludge, cinders, mine spoils and ashes), pavements with their underlying unconsolidated materials, soils with geomembranes and constructed soils in human-made materials.

label: back-arc basin
definition: A depression in the sea floor that results from the collision of continental plates; the weight of the sinking plate causes the overlying plate to stretch and thin, causing a basin in the overlying plate. Sometimes, the Earth's crust in these basins stretches so much it cracks, allowing magma through from the mantle beneath. Hence, basins often contain active volcanoes and hydrothermal vents.

label: ocean basin
definition: A structural basin that is below sea level.

label: alluvial soil
definition: Soil which has been eroded and influenced by flowing water and redeposited in a non-marine setting.

label: oil contaminated soil
definition: Soil which has elevated concentrations of oil.

label: animal house
definition: A house used for sheltering non-human animals.

label: cow shed
definition: An animal house which is used to shelter cows.

label: piggery
definition: An animal house which is used to house pigs.

label: sewage plant
definition: A waste treatment plant which equipped to treat sewage such that its potential for environmental contamination is reduced.

label: metal contaminated soil
definition: Soil which has elevated concentrations of metals.

definition: A portion of enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of some material entity.

label: tannery
definition: A tannery is a building in which the skins of animals are treated with chemicals to alter the structure of their constituent proteins, creating leather.

label: industrial building
definition: An industrial building is a building within which goods are produced and, optionally, stored or within which services are rendered.

label: dairy
definition: A dairy is a building in which animal milk is harvested and, optionally, processed for human consumption.

label: food processing building
definition: A food processing building is a building in which materials that contain or consist of essential body nutrients - such as carbohydrates, fats, proteins, vitamins, or minerals - and may be ingested and assimilated by an organism to produce energy, stimulate growth, and maintain life are converted alternative forms.

label: bakery
definition: A bakery is a building in which raw flour-based food is baked in an oven to produce food products such as bread, cakes, pastries, and pies. These products are often sold from the bakery itself.

label: brewery
definition: A brewery is a building in which alcoholic beverages are produced by brewing, that is, steeping a starch source (commonly cereal grains) in water and fermenting the resulting sweet liquid with yeast. At times, the products are also sold from the brewery.

label: sake brewery
definition: A sake brewery is a brewery which produces rice wine by fermenting rice which has been polished to remove the bran.

label: chalk soil
definition: Soil which has increased levels of chalk.

label: research station
definition: A building or collection of co-located buildings constructed for the purpose of undertaking scientific research.

label: warehouse
definition: A warehouse is a building which is used for the storage of goods.

label: tobacco warehouse
definition: A tobacco warehouse is a warehouse used to store cured leaves of plants from the genus Nicotiana, primarily  N. tabacum and N. rustica.

label: creamery
definition: A creamery is a part of a dairy where cream is separated from whole milk.

label: sawmill
definition: A building within which logs are cut into lumber products.

label: karst field
definition: A large flat plain in karst territory with areas usually 5 to 400 sqaure kilometres.

label: paddy field soil
definition: Soil which is part of a paddy field.

label: alpine soil
definition: Soil which is part of an alpine environment.

label: arable soil
definition: Soil which is capable of supporting the growth of crops.

label: roadside soil
definition: A portion of soil which is found in a roadside area.

label: allotment garden soil
definition: Soil which is part of an allotment garden.

label: allotment garden
definition: A garden which is made available for individual, non-commercial gardening or growing food plants.

label: savanna soil
definition: A portion of soil which is found in a savanna.

label: compost soil
definition: Soil which is derived from compost.

label: dry soil
definition: Soil which has little to no water content and in which minerals and other soluble chemical entities have either bonded or become adsorbed to sold particles due to insufficient water availability.

label: farm soil
definition: A portion of soil which is part of a cropland or a rangeland biome.

label: grassland soil
definition: A portion of soil which is found in a grassland.

label: jungle soil
definition: Soil which is part of a densely forested area subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: sawah soil
definition: Soil which is part of a sawah, a wet or irrigated rice field.

label: urea enriched soil
definition: A portion of urea enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of urea.

label: fertilized soil
definition: Soil which has been amended with fertilizers.

label: field soil
definition: Soil which is part of an agricultural field.

label: lawn soil
definition: Soil which is formulated to promote the growth of grasses or other plants used to establish managed areas of vegetation.

label: bacteria enriched soil
definition: A portion of bacteria enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated bacterial abundance.

label: alluvial swamp soil
definition: A portion of alluvial soil which is part of a swamp ecosystem.

label: alluvial paddy field soil
definition: Alluvial soil whichi is part of a paddy field.

label: burned soil
definition: Soil which has been transformed through a combustion process.

label: meadow soil
definition: Soil which is part of a meadow.

label: chloropicrin enriched soil
definition: A portion of chloropicrin enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of chloropicrin.

label: humus-rich acidic ash soil
definition: Soil which 1) has increased levels of humus, 2) has low pH levels, 3) has increased levels of mineral ash.

label: pond soil
definition: Soil which is adjacent to a pond.

label: frozen compost soil
definition: Compost soil which is frozen.

label: limed soil
definition: Soil which has been amended with mineral additives to increase its pH.

label: manured soil
definition: Soil which has, as a part, a portion of either fresh or processed animal manure.

label: orchid soil
definition: Soil which has properties to which plants in the Family Orchidaceae have adapted, including increased levels of aeration and drainage.

label: mountain forest soil
definition: Soil which is part of a forest growing on a mountain.

label: beech forest soil
definition: Soil which is part of a forest whose communites of arborescent plants are dominated the genus Fagus.

label: muddy soil
definition: Soil which is composed of a large proportion of mud, thus having properties resembling mud.

label: orchard soil
definition: Soil in which trees from an orchard grow.

label: pasture soil
definition: Soil which is found in a pasture and in which vegetation, such as the grass used for the grazing of ungulates, grows.

label: peat soil
definition: A histosol which is formed by the decomposition of vegetation or organic matter.

label: salt contaminated soil
definition: Soil which has elevated concentrations of sodium chloride.

label: peaty paddy field soil
definition: Paddy field soil which has increased levels of peat.

label: steppe soil
definition: A portion of soil which is found in a steppe.

label: tropical soil
definition: Soil which is part of a tropical environment.

label: vegetable garden soil
definition: Garden soil which is part of a garden used for the cultivation of vegetables.

label: greenhouse soil
definition: A portion of soil which is found in a greenhouse.

label: heat stressed soil
definition: Soil which is has been heated such that its chemical, physical, or biological properties are destabilised.

label: ornithogenic soil
definition: Soil which is formed from avian fecal matter.

label: leafy wood soil
definition: Soil which is part of a woodland dominated by leafy trees.

label: spruce forest soil
definition: Soil which is part of a forest whose communites of arborescent plants are dominated the genus Picea.

label: upland soil
definition: Soil which is part of some elevated land.

label: eucalyptus forest soil
definition: Soil which is part of a forest whose communites of arborescent plants are dominated the genus Eucalyptus.

label: bluegrass field soil
definition: Bluegrass field soil is a soil which is found in a field of Kentucky Bluegrass (Poa pratensis).

label: red soil
definition: Soil which has 1) low concentrations of nutrients and humus, 2) low water retention capacity, 3) textural variation from sand to clay, 4) a porous and friable structure, and 5) low concentrations of soluble salts.

label: marine mud
definition: Mud which is part of a marine ecosystem.

label: lake bottom mud
definition: Mud which constitutes the bed of a lake.

label: desert sand
definition: Sand which is part of a desert.

label: rhizosphere
definition: The narrow region of soil that is directly influenced by root secretions and associated soil microorganisms.

label: bulk soil
definition: Soil that is not penetrated by the root systems of plants.

label: ice rise
definition: An ice rise is an elevation which is part of an ice shelf, typically dome shared, and formed by the ice shelf overriding an obstruction in the seabed. An ice rise may be adjacent only to an ice shelf, or to an ice shelf and a sea. For some features, properly ice rises, the term island has become established through usage.

label: strand crack
definition: Fissure at the junction between an inland ice sheet, ice piedmont or ice rise and an ice shelf, the latter being subject to the rise and fall of the tide.

label: midden
definition: A dump for domestic waste. A term used to describe any kind of feature containing waste products relating to day-to-day human life.

label: botanical garden
definition: A place where a wide variety of plants primarily categorized and documented for scientific purposes.

label: zoological garden
definition: A facility in which animals are confined within enclosures and displayed to the public, and in which they may also be bred.

label: ocean time series station
definition: A research facility consisting of instruments that measure the properties of the oceans over time. Usually of at least approximately fixed location.

label: karst cave
definition: A cave which is part of a karst formation.

label: dry stream valley
definition: A dry valley which was formed as a result of erosion due to stream formation and flow.

label: dry river valley
definition: A dry stream valley which was formed as a result of erosion due to river formation and flow.

label: humus
definition: Organic matter in soil which has reached a point of stability, where it will break down no further and might, if conditions do not change, remain essentially as it is for centuries, or millennia.

label: water well
definition: A well which provides access to groundwater held  in an aquifer.

label: oil well
definition: A well which has been drilled in order to extract petroleum oil from subterranean reservoirs and bring it to the surface.

label: concentration basin mediterranean sea biome
definition: The concentration basin mediterranean sea biome comprises expressions of the mediterranean sea biome that have higher salinity than bordering oceans due to evaporation. Water exchange consists of inflow of the fresher oceanic water in the upper layer and outflow of the saltier mediterranean water in the lower layer of the connecting channel.

label: upwelling
definition:
