SOURCE DEFINITION: A marine upwelling is a net flow of marine water to the surface of the water column from deeper regions. This is often a result of surface water displacement off continental coasts by wind action. Localised upwellings may also occur along divergent fronts around eddies and along some of the major oceanographic features. Deeper waters often have higher nutrient content; consequently blooms of primary producers, such as planktonic algae, are generally observed around upwelling zones.

label: coastal upwelling
definition: An upwelling that is near a coast.

label: cave floor
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A solid surface layer which 1) forms part of the boundary between the cavity of a cave and its solid container and 2)  is the closest solid boundary to the gravitational centre of the astronomical body of which the cave is a part.

label: estuarine biome
definition: Expressions of the estuarine biome occur at wide lower courses of a rivers where they flow into a sea. Estuaries experience tidal flows and their water is a changing mixture of fresh and salt.

label: marine salt marsh biome
definition: The marine salt marsh biome comprises marshes that are transitional intertidals between land and salty or brackish marine water (e.g.: sloughs, bays, estuaries). It is dominated by halophytic (salt tolerant) herbaceous plants. The daily tidal surges bring in nutrients, which tend to settle in roots of the plants within the salt marsh. The natural chemical activity of salty (or brackish) water and the tendency of algae to bloom in the shallow unshaded water also allow for great biodiversity.

label: marine pelagic biome
definition: The marine pelagic biome (pelagic meaning open sea) is that of the marine water column, from the surface to the greatest depths.

label: marine benthic biome
definition: The marine benthic biome (benthic meaning 'bottom') encompasses the seafloor and includes such areas as shores, littoral or intertidal areas, marine coral reefs, and the deep seabed.

label: marine neritic benthic zone biome
definition: The marine neritic zone biome comprises sea floor from the high tide mark to a continental shelf break. This zone generally extends to 200 m below average sea level.

label: marine bathyal zone biome
definition: The marine bathyal zone biome comprises regions of the marine benthic biome between approximately 200 m and 3000 m depth. This zone generally coincides with the continental slope.

label: marine abyssal zone biome
definition: The marine abyssal zone biome comprises regions of the marine benthic biome  between approximately 2500 m and 6000 m depth. This zone generally coincides with the continental rise and the abyssal plain.

label: marine hadal zone biome
definition: The marine hadal zone biome describes sea floor deeper than 6000 m such as that of the oceanic trenches.

label: marine reef biome
definition: A biome expressed by strips or ridges of rocks, sand, or coral that rises to or near the surface of a body of marine water.

label: marine hydrothermal vent biome
definition: The marine hydrothermal vent biome comprises regions of the marine benthic biome where heat generated due to tectonic activity, either at divergent plate boundaries or convergent ocean plates where back-arc spreading occurs, is released or 'vented' to the surface. The resultant high temperature water jets are laden with dissolved metals and minerals.

label: neritic pelagic zone biome
definition: The neritic epipelagic zone biome comprises the marine water column above a continental shelf.

label: oceanic pelagic zone biome
definition: The oceanic epipelagic zone biome comprises the marine water column offshore, beyond a continental shelf.

label: oceanic sea surface microlayer biome
definition: The oceanic sea surface microlayer (SML) biome comprises the top 1000 micrometers of the marine surface waters occurring offshore, away from a continental shelf. It is the boundary layer where all exchange occurs between the atmosphere and the ocean. The chemical, physical, and biological properties of the SML differ greatly from the sub-surface water just a few centimeters beneath.

label: oceanic epipelagic zone biome
definition: The oceanic epipelagic zone biome comprises regions of the marine water column that occur offshore, beyond a continental shelf. This biome extends from the surface of the ocean to a depth of ca. 200-250m. Throughout the zone the light field tends to be asymmetrical vertically, so that the direction and elevation of the sun can still be detected. The oceanic epipelagic zone biome encompasses the euphotic zone and, where and when it occurs, the seasonal thermocline.

label: oceanic mesopelagic zone biome
definition: The oceanic mesopelagic zone biome comprises regions of the marine water column that occur offshore, beyond a continental shelf. This biome extends through the water column from approximately 200-1000 m depth - the maximal depth of light penetration in all but the clearest oligotrophic ocean regions. In comparison to the epipelagic zone, dominant forms of pelagic organisms do not change very much; however, there are marked changes in species composition and the proportion of smaller-sized individuals decreases.

label: oceanic bathypelagic zone biome
definition: The bathypelagic zone biome comprises the marine water column below approximately 1000 m water depth - the maximum depth to which detectable daylight penetrates in all but the clearest oligotrophic waters - and extends to about 2500 - 2700 m water depth. In the temperate Atlantic, the beginning of the bathypelagic zone biome approximates to the deep oxygen minimum and the base of the permanent thermocline.

label: oceanic abyssopelagic zone biome
definition: The abyssopelagic zone biome comprises the marine water column below the bathypelagic zone biome at approximately 2500 -2700 m and extends either to the hadal pelagic zone biome (at approximately 6000 m) or to the benthopelagic zone biome within ca. 100 m of the seafloor. The depth of 2700 m may be critical for physiological reasons as the change in hydrostatic pressure across this depth may preclude organism migration.

label: oceanic hadal pelagic zone biome
definition: The oceanic hadal pelagic zone biome comprises the water column in oceanic trenches occurring at depths between 6000m and 10,000m.

label: oceanic benthopelagic zone biome
definition: The benthopelagic zone biome comprises regions of the marine water column which usually coincide with the benthic boundary layer (BBL) - the layer of isothermal and isohaline water contiguous to the sea floor. A general reversal in the declining gradient of pelagic biomass may be observed here, perhaps explained by viable nutrition on the sea floor being resuspended by bottom currents. This zone typically extends 100 m above the seafloor, but may reach upto1000 m during benthic storms.

label: neritic sea surface microlayer biome
definition: The neritic sea surface microlayer (SML) biome comprises the top 1000 micrometers of marine surface waters occurring above a continental shelf. It is the boundary layer where all exchange occurs between the atmosphere and the ocean. The chemical, physical, and biological properties of the SML differ greatly from the sub-surface water just a few centimeters beneath.

label: neritic epipelagic zone biome
definition: The neritic epipelagic zone biome comprises the marine water column that occurs above a continental shelf and extends from the surface of the ocean to a depth of ca. 200-250m. Throughout the zone the light field tends to be asymmetrical vertically, so that the direction and elevation of the sun can still be detected. The epipelagic zone encompasses the euphotic zone and, where and when it occurs, the seasonal thermocline.

label: neritic mesopelagic zone biome
definition: The neritic mesopelagic zone biome comprises the marine column that occurs above a continental shelf and extends from approximately 200 to 1000 m depth - the maximal depth of light penetration in all but the clearest oligotrophic ocean regions. In comparison to the epipelagic zone, dominant forms of pelagic organisms do not change very much; however, there are marked changes in species composition and the proportion of smaller-sized individuals decreases.

label: epeiric sea biome
definition: The epeiric sea (also known as an epicontinental sea) biome comprises a shallow seas that extend over part of a continent. Epeiric seas are usually associated with the marine transgressions of the geologic  past, which have variously been due to either global eustatic sea level changes, local tectonic deformation, or both, and are occasionally semi-cyclic.

label: marginal sea biome
definition: The marginal sea biome comprises parts of an ocean partially enclosed by land such as islands, archipelagos, or peninsulas. Unlike mediterranean seas, marginal seas have ocean currents caused by ocean winds. Many marginal seas are enclosed by island arcs that were formed from the subduction of one oceanic plate beneath another.

label: mediterranean sea biome
definition: The mediterranean sea biome comprises mostly enclosed seas that have limited exchange of deep water with outer oceans and where the water circulation is dominated by salinity and temperature differences rather than winds.

label: ocean biome
definition: A marine biome which is determined by an ocean.

label: marine coral reef biome
definition: The marine coral reef biome comprises constructional wave-resistant entities which are primarily built by corals and are often cemented together. The growth of these structures is aided by zooxanthellae, algae that are symbiotic with the reef-building corals.

label: marine subtidal rocky reef biome
definition: The marine rocky subtidal reef biome comprises regions of the marine reef biome composed mainly of rock and which harbour abundant communities of algae and invertebrates. These reefs are often very patchy, with alterations of rocks dominated by rich invertebrate assemblages and turf-forming calcareous red algae.

label: marine black smoker biome
definition: A marine black smoker biome comprises regions of the marine hydrothermal vent biome characterised by a black vent plume. This black plume is a consequence of dissolved metals and minerals forming complexes with sulphide and indicates polymetallic sulphide mineral deposits beneath the surface.

label: marine white smoker biome
definition: A marine white smoker biome comprises regions of the marine hydrothermal vent biome characterised by lightly hued plumes, typically containing barium, calcium, and silicon. These vents tend to have lower temperature plumes when compared to black smoker environments.

label: marine ultramafic hydrothermal vent biome
definition: A marine ultramafic hydrothermal vent biome comprises regions of themarine  hydrothermal vent biome hosted on ultramafic (also referred to as ultrabasic) rocks. Ultramafic rocks are igneous and meta-igneous rocks with very low silica content (less than 45%), generally >18% MgO, high FeO, low potassium, and are composed of usually greater than 90% mafic minerals  (dark colored, high magnesium and iron content). The Earth's mantle is composed of ultramafic rocks.

label: marine basaltic hydrothermal vent biome
definition: A marine basaltic hydrothermal vent biome comprises regions of the marine hydrothermal vent biome hosted on basaltic rocks. Basalt generally has a composition of 45 to 55 wt % SiO2, 2 to 6 wt % total alkalis, 0.5 to 2.0 wt % TiO2, 5 to 14 wt % FeO and 14 wt % or more Al2O3. Contents of CaO are commonly near 10 wt %, those of MgO commonly in the range 5 to 12 wt %.

label: marine algal bloom
definition: A marine algal bloom is a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae in a marine system. Typically, only one or a small number of phytoplankton  species are involved. Although there is no officially recognized threshold level, algae can be considered to be blooming at concentrations of hundreds to thousands of cells per milliliter, depending on the severity.

label: kelp forest
definition: Kelp forests are underwater areas with a high density of kelp. They are recognized as one of the most productive and dynamic ecosystems on Earth. Smaller areas of anchored kelp are called kelp beds.

label: sea grass bed
definition: A bed of a marine, saline water body which is covered by one or more speices of seagrass typically belonging to the families Posidoniaceae, Zosteraceae, Hydrocharitaceae, or Cymodoceaceae.

label: marine wind mixed layer
definition: The upper part of the marine water column with generally uniform properties resulting from wind-driven mixing.

label: marine benthic storm
definition: Benthic storms are strong benthic (near bottom) currents transporting sediment, created by the input of energy (largely kinetic) to the seabed. In regions with high mesoscale eddy activity, benthic storms are frequent and can create isohaline and isothermal conditions extending as much as 1000m above the seafloor.

label: marine downwelling
definition: A marine downwelling describes a net current of marine surface water towards deeper regions of the water column. Marine downwellings are usually caused by differences in the density (and hence, temperature and salinity) of seawater.

label: marine oxygen minimum zone
definition: A marine water mass which is characterized by having much lower than normal dissolved oxygen concentrations persistently.

label: marine anoxic zone
definition: Marine anoxic zones are areas of marine water that are depleted of dissolved oxygen. This condition is generally found in areas that have restricted water exchange. In most cases, oxygen is prevented from reaching the deeper levels by a physical barrier (sill) as well as by a pronounced density stratification. Anoxic conditions will occur if the rate of oxidation of organic matter by bacteria is greater than the supply of dissolved oxygen.

label: marine current
definition: A water current which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of marine water, generated by forces caused by breaking waves, wind, Coriolis force, temperature and salinity differences, and tides caused by the gravitational pull of astronomical bodies. Depth contours, shoreline configurations and interaction with other currents influence a current's direction and strength.

label: marine streamer
definition: Marine streamers are tongues of cold water that extend > 100 km offshore from upwelling regions. Enhanced primary productivity may occur in these waters as they are typically more nutrient rich than marine surface waters.

label: mesoscale marine eddy
definition: Mesoscale marine eddies are characterized by currents which flow in a roughly circular motion around the center of the eddy. The sense of rotation of these currents may either be cyclonic or anticyclonic. Ocean eddies are also usually made of water masses that are different to those outside of the eddy. Marine mesoscale eddies are between about 10 and 500 km in diameter, and persist for periods of days to months. They may be formed when an ocean current develops an instability. This instability grows, causing the current to meander, and eventually an eddy is pinched off from the meander.

label: marine Taylor column
definition: A marine Taylor column is a Taylor column that is formed in a marine body of water. Currents flowing over shoaling topography such as seamounts are accelerated and destabilised, resulting in Taylor columns. Eddies and internal waves are generated downstream of the topological feature and may extend 1000 m or so above them. This may result in a localised increase in primary production where the Taylor column reaches surface waters.

label: marine oligotrophic desert
definition: A marine water mass which is composed primarily of water with low concentrations of nutrients.

label: oceanic gyre
definition: A gyre in oceanography is any large system of rotating ocean currents, particularly those involved with large wind movements. Gyres are caused by the Coriolis Effect; planetary vorticity  along with horizontal and vertical friction, which determine the circulation patterns from the wind curl (torque).

label: marine thermocline
definition: A thermocline which is part of a marine water body.

label: marine chemocline
definition: A marine chemocline is a marine cline caused by a strong, vertical chemistry gradient within a body of marine water. Chemoclines most commonly occur where local conditions favor the formations of anoxic bottom water.

label: marine pycnocline
definition: A pycnocline which is part of a marine water body and composed primarily of sea water.

label: marine nutricline
subClassOf [LABEL]: marine cline|nutricline within a water body
definition: A nutricline which is part of a marine water body.

label: pelagic isothermal surface
definition: A roughly planar, pelagic region characterised by equal water temperature.

label: pelagic isohaline surface
definition: A roughly planar, pelagic region characterised by equal salinity.

label: pelagic isopycnal surface
definition: A roughly planar, pelagic region characterised by equal water density.

label: deep ocean current
definition: A marine current that generally occurs below the permanent thermocline (where it occurs) or below 400 m depth and that is driven by density and temperature gradients.

label: marine surface current
definition: A marine current bordered by the surface of the water column and the permanent thermocline, where it occurs. Surface currents are mostly wind driven and mostly limited to the top 400 m of the water column. Ocean currents are driven by the circulation of wind above surface waters. Frictional stress at the interface between the ocean and the wind causes the water to move in the direction of the wind. Large ocean currents are a response of the atmosphere and ocean to the flow of energy from the tropics to polar regions. In some cases, currents are transient features and affect only a small area. Other ocean currents are essentially permanent and extend over large horizontal distances.

label: along-front current
definition: A marine surface current that flows along an oceanic front.

label: western boundary current
definition: A warm water, narrow marine surface current flowing from the equator to high latitudes at speeds between 40 and 120 kilometers per day. Western boundary currents are the deepest ocean surface flows, usually extending 1000 meters below the ocean surface.

label: eastern boundary current
definition: A cold water, broad marine surface current flowing from high latitudes to the equator at speeds between 3 and 7 kilometers per day.

label: permanent marine thermocline
definition: A marine thermocline which separates the marine cold-water sphere from the marine warm-water sphere and which does not dissipate seasonally.

label: seasonal marine thermocline
definition: A marine thermocline which is present below the marine wind mixed layer.

label: marine cold-water sphere
definition: The marine cold-water sphere describes a water mass extending from the polar seas and across low latitudes at depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m, which is separated from the marine warm-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: marine warm-water sphere
definition: The marine warm-water sphere describes a water mass extending to depths of ca. 800 to 1000 m in low and middle latitudes. It is separated from the marine cold-water sphere by the permanent marine thermocline

label: marine hydrothermal vent
definition: A marine hydrothermal vent is a marine benthic feature where heat generated due to tectonic activity, either at divergent plate boundaries or convergent ocean plates where back-arc spreading occurs, is released or 'vented' to the surface. The resultant high temperature water jets are laden with dissolved metals and minerals.

label: marine sponge reef biome
definition: The marine sponge reef biome comprises marine reefs primarily built by marine sponges. The primary frame-building sponges are all members of the order Hexactinosa. They are found only in glacier-scoured troughs of low-angle continental shelf. The seafloor is stable and consists of rock, coarse gravel, and large boulders.

label: marine supra-littoral zone
SYNONYMS: marine supralittoral zone|splash zone|spray zone|supralittoral zone|supratidal zone
definition: The supralittoral zone is the area above the spring high tide line that is regularly splashed, but not submerged by ocean water. Seawater penetrates these elevated areas only during storms with high tides.

label: marine littoral zone
definition: The marine littoral zone is a littoral zone which extends, approximately, from the spray region above the high tide mark to the edge of the coninental shelf.

label: marine sub-littoral zone
definition: The marine sublittoral zone is part of the marine littoral zone which is permanently covered by seawater. In physical oceanography, the sublittoral zone refers to coastal regions with significant tidal flows and energy dissipation, including non-linear flows, internal waves, river outflows and oceanic fronts. In practice, this typically extends to the edge of the continental shelf, with depths around 200 meters. In marine biology, the sublittoral refers to the areas where sunlight reaches the ocean floor, that is, where the water is never so deep as to take it out of the photic zone.

label: marine cold seep biome
definition: A marine benthic biome which is determined by a cold seep.

label: dilution basin mediterranean sea biome
definition: The dilution basin mediterranean sea biome comprises expressions of the mediterranean sea biome with lower salinity than the surrounding ocean due to freshwater gains such as rainfall and rivers. Water exchange consists of outflow of the fresher mediterranean water in the upper layer and inflow of the saltier oceanic water in the lower layer of the channel. Renewal of deep water may not be sufficient to supply oxygen to the bottom.

label: marine hydrothermal vent chimney
definition: A column of solid material which has been progressively deposited around a hydrothermal vent.

label: marine hydrothermal plume
definition: A marine hydrothermal vent plume, part of a marine hydrothermal vent, is a high temperature water jet laden with dissolved metals and minerals that is driven by heat generated due to tectonic activity below the vent.

label: drop stone
definition: A piece of rock which fell vertically through the water column into finer-grained water-deposited sedimentary rocks.

label: marine reef
definition: A reef which is located in a marine water body.

label: marine coral reef deep fore reef
marine subtidal rocky reef
definition: A rocky reef which is located in the subtidal zone of a marine water body.

label: marine pockmark
definition: Pockmarks are craters in the seabed resulting from the release of gas or liquid. Generally, they are formed in soft, fine-grained seabed sediments by the escape of fluids (gas or water, but mainly methane) into the water column.

label: marine sponge reef
definition: A marine sponge reef is marine reefs primarily built by marine sponges. The primary frame-building sponges are all members of the order Hexactinosa. They are found only in glacier-scoured troughs of low-angle continental shelf. The seafloor is stable and consists of rock, coarse gravel, and large boulders.

label: forest biome
definition: A forest ecosystem which is undergoing climactic ecological succession.

label: woodland biome
definition: A woodland biome is a terrestrial biome which includes, across its entire spatial extent, woody plants spaced sufficiently far apart to allow light penetration to support communities of herbaceous plants or shrubs living closer to the woodland floor.

label: shrubland biome
definition: A shrubland biome is a terrestrial biome which includes, across its entire spatial extent, dense groups of shrubs.

label: grassland biome
definition: A grassland ecosystem in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: savanna biome
definition: A woodland biome which has seasonal water availability and includes trees spaced sufficiently far apart to allow an unbroken layer of grass, sedge (Cyperaceae) or  rush (Juncaceae) communities to live.

label: desert biome
definition: A desert ecosystem which is undergoing climactic ecological succession.

label: tundra biome
definition: A tundra ecosystem which is undergoing climactic ecological succession.

label: mangrove biome
definition: A mangrove biome is a terrestrial biome which includes, across its spatial extent, mangrove plants (Rhizophoraceae). Mangrove plants are able to withstand high levels of salinity as well as regions of anoxia and frequent tidal inundation. Mangrove biomes often occur near tropical and sub-tropical estuaries and depositional marine coastal environments where fine sediments (often with high organic content) collect in areas protected from high energy wave action.

label: temperate desert biome
definition: A temperate desert biome is a desert biome which has communities adapted to intermediate insolation, low rainfall, and large temperature variations between winter and summer. Winter temperatures may fall below 0 degrees Celsius. Some precipitation in this biome may fall as snow.

label: tropical desert biome
definition: A tropical desert biome is a desert biome which has communities adapted to temperatures above a monthly average of 18 degrees Celsius, high daily temperature ranges of approximately 20 degrees Celsius, very high insolation due to inhibited cloud formation, and very low precipitation. Tropical desert biomes located near coasts with cold upwellings may have cooler temperatures and reduced insolution due to fog.

label: subtropical desert biome
definition: A subtropical desert biome is a desert biome which has communities adapted to temperatures above a monthly average of 18 degrees Celsius, high daily temperature ranges of approximately 20 degrees Celsius, high insolation (but lower than that of a tropical desert biome), inhibited cloud formation, and very low precipitation. Subtropical desert biomes located near coasts with cold upwellings may have cooler temperatures and reduced insolution due to fog.

label: montane desert biome
definition: A montane desert biome is a desert biome which occurs in regions elevated above sea level and which has community structure determined by elevation-dependent environmental conditions.

label: polar desert biome
definition: A polar desert biome is a desert biome which is subject to low levels of insolation, annual precipitation less than 250 millimeters, and a mean temperature less than 10 degrees Celsius during its warmest month. Temperature changes in polar deserts frequently cross the freezing point of water.

label: subtropical savanna biome
definition: A savanna biome which is subject to subtropical climate patterns.

label: tropical savanna biome
definition: A savanna biome which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate savanna biome
definition: A savanna biome which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: flooded savanna biome
definition: A flooded savanna biome is a savanna biome which has very wet to saturated soil moisture content.

label: subtropical grassland biome
definition: A subtropical grassland in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: montane grassland biome
definition: A montane grassland biome is a grassland biome which occurs in regions elevated above sea level and which has community structure determined by elevation-dependent environmental conditions.

label: coniferous forest biome
definition: A coniferous forest biome is a forest biome which contains densely packed populations or communities of coniferous trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: broadleaf forest biome
definition: A broadleaf forest ecosystem which is undergoing climactic ecological succession.

label: mixed forest biome
definition: A mixed forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

definition: An anthropogenic terrestrial biome is a terrestrial biome which has community structures determined by human activity.

label: subtropical woodland biome

label: mediterranean grassland biome

label: mediterranean savanna biome
definition: A savanna biome which is subject to mediterranean climate patterns.

label: coastal scrubland
definition: A coastal scrubland is a scrubland which is part of a coast.

label: oak woodland
definition: An oak woodland is a woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of oak trees.

label: conifer woodland
definition: A conifer woodland is a woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of coniferous trees, from the Division Pinophyta, also known as Coniferophyta or Coniferae.

label: juniper woodland
definition: A juniper woodland is a woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of trees of the genus Juniperus.

label: desert scrubland
definition: A scrubland which is located in a desert.

label: pinyon juniper woodland
definition: A pinyon juniper woodland is a conifer woodland which has a tree community primarily composed of trees of the subsection Cembroides of the genus Pinus and the genus Juniperus.

label: cropland biome
definition: A cropland ecosystem which is undergoing climactic ecological succession.

label: village biome
definition: A village biome is an anthropogenic terrestrial biome which contains settlements such as villages, towns, and/or small cities and which is primarily used for agricultural activity.

label: rangeland biome
definition: A rangeland biome is an anthropogenic terrestrial biome which is primarily used for the rearing and grazing of livestock.

label: dense settlement biome
definition: A dense settlement biome is an anthropogenic terrestrial biome which is primarily used for human habitation, recreation, and industry within built structures with little other land use.

label: urban biome
definition: An urban biome is a dense settlement biome which has been urbanised.

label: subpolar coniferous forest biome
definition: A  coniferous forest biome which includes communities adapted to subpolar conditions.

label: freshwater lake biome
definition: A biome which is determined by a freshwater lake.

label: freshwater river biome
definition: A freshwater biome which is determined by a freshwater river.

label: mineral deposit
definition: A mineral deposit is a physiographic feature which has unusually high concentrations of one or more minerals.

label: white smoker
definition: A hydrothermal vent found on the ocean floor which emits lighter-hued minerals, such as those containing barium, calcium and silicon. These alkaline hydrothermal vents also continuously generate acetyl thioesters, providing both the starting point for more complex organic molecules and the energy needed to produce them.

label: nutricline within a water body
definition: A nutricline which is part of a water body.

label: seep
definition: A seep is a spring in which water has filtered through permeable earth to the surface.

label: cold seep
definition:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A cold seep is a seep in which methane and other hydrocarbon-rich fluids rise to the sea floor.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: An area of the ocean floor where hydrogen sulfide, methane and other hydrocarbon-rich fluid seepage occurs. Cold seeps are distinct from hydrothermal vents: the former's emissions are of the same temperature as the surrounding seawater, whereas the latter's emissions are super-heated.

label: hydrothermal seep
definition: A hydrothermal seep is a seep in which diffuse flow of geothermally heated fluids with high methane concentrations. This seep has been proposed as an intermediate between cold seeps and hydrothermal vents.

label: structural basin
definition: A structural basin is a geological depression formed by tectonic warping of previously flat lying rock strata.

label: ecoregion
definition: A large unit of land or water containing a geographically distinct assemblage of species, natural communities, and environmental conditions.

label: pingo scar
definition: A depression caused by the collapse of a pingo.

label: ice lens
definition: An ice mass which is formed when moisture, diffused within soil or rock, accumulates and freezes in a localized zone, wedging soil or rock apart.

label: ecozone
definition: Ecozones delineate large areas of a planetary surface within which organisms have been evolving in relative isolation over long periods of time, separated from one another by geographic features, such as oceans, broad deserts, or high mountain ranges, that constitute barriers to migration.

label: lake layer
definition: A layer which is part of a lake.

label: amictic lake
definition: A lake which is permanently covered by ice, does not mix, and exhibit inverse cold water stratification whereby water temperature increases with depth below the ice surface.

label: holomictic lake
definition: A holomictic lake is a lake which mixes at least once per year. Mixing is caused by a uniform temperature distribution from the upper to lower layers of the lake.

label: dimictic lake
definition: A dimitic lake is a holomictic lake which mixes from top to bottom during two mixing periods each year. Mixing typically occurs during the spring and autumn, when the lake is "isothermal" (i.e., at the same temperature from the top to the bottom). At this time the water throughout the lake is about 4C, and, in the absence of any temperature or density differences, the lake readily mixes from top to bottom. These lakes are common in regions with temperate climates.

label: polymictic lake
definition: A polymictic lake is a holomictic lake which is too shallow to allow thermal stratification and which can mix from top to bottom through the ice-free period of the year.

label: monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic  lake is a holomictic lake which mixes from top to bottom during one mixing period each year.

label: cold monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic lake which is covered by ice throughout much of the year and only mixes when its surface ice melts and the lake lacks thermal stratification.

label: warm monomictic lake
definition: A monomictic lake which does not freeze and is thermally stratified throughout most of the year, only mixing in winter when cooler temperatures ease stratification.

label: cold polymictic lake
definition: A cold polymictic lake is a polymictic lake which is covered by ice in winter.

label: warm polymictic lake
definition: A warm polymictic lake is a polymictic lake which is not covered by ice at any point during the year.

label: ice mass
definition: A mass of water ice.

label: crevice
definition: A deep fissure in rock.

label: marine layer
definition: A layer that is part of a marine water body.

label: dry lake bed
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A lake bed which is dry. That is, the bed of a dry lake.

label: freshwater river
definition: A river where fresh water flows.

label: continental margin
definition: A slope which is part of the seafloor, descends from the continental crust to the oceanic crust, and comprises the continental shelf, continental slope, and continental rise.

label: Taylor column
definition: A Taylor column is a column of deflected fluid flow which is formed in a perturbed, rotating fluid, is parallel to the axis of rotation, and extends above the obstacle perturbing the fluid in a rigid manner.

label: atmospheric Taylor column
definition: An atmospheric Taylor column is a Taylor column that is formed in the atmosphere. Atmospheric Taylor columns often form above islands resulting in vortex streets in the atmosphere.

label: estuarine water
definition: Brackish water which is part of an estuary.

label: outcrop
definition: A portion of environmental material which protrudes through a surface layer.

label: rocky slope
definition: A rocky slope is a slope which has a surface primarily composed of rock.

label: marine environment
definition: A marine environment and enviroment which is determined by a marine water body.

label: planetary surface
definition: A planetary surface is a surface layer where the solid or liquid material of a planet comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: gravelly slope
definition: A gravelly slope is a slope which has a surface primarily composed of gravel.

label: hillside
definition: A hillside is a slope that is part of a hill.

label: talus slope
definition: A talus slope is a slope which has a surface layer composed of scree.

label: polar biome
definition: A biome which is subject to polar climatic conditions.

label: montane conifer woodland
definition: A montane conifer woodland is a conifer woodland which is located within an altitude range that falls between mid-altitude forests and the tree line.

label: maize field
definition: A field  used for the cultivation of corn or related crop plants.

label: field
definition: An unbroken expanse (as of ice)

label: marine mesoscale eddy field
definition: A mesoscale eddy field is an expanse of marine water which includes coherent vortices, as well as a rich cascade of other structures such as filaments, squirts and spirals and is characterized by temperature and salinity anomalies with associated flow anomalies that are nearly in geostrophic balance. Although only the surface expression of mesoscale eddies is visible in satellite images of sea surface height or temperature, they are in fact three dimensional structures that reach down into the pycnocline.

label: limestone cave
definition: A cave formed in limestone, usually by dissolution of limestone by acidic groundwater.

label: solutional cave
definition: A cave formed by the dissolution of soluble rock or other solid material such as limestone, chalk, dolomite, gypsum, salt or marble.

label: primary cave
definition: A cave formed at the same time as the surrounding rock.

label: inflationary cave
definition: A cave that is formed by the action of pressurised lava pushing against surrounding rock and then draining away.

label: erosional cave
definition: A cave formed by erosion caused by flowing streams carrying rocks or sediments.

label: glacier cave
definition: A glacier cave is a cave formed within or under a glacier.

label: ice cave
definition: An ice cave is a bedrock cave which contains year-round ice formations.

label: talus cave
definition: A talus cave is a cave formed by the openings between large boulders which have fallen into a random heap.

label: anchialine cave
definition: An anchialine cave is a cave which contains an anchialine pool.

label: anchialine pool
definition: An anchialine pool is a landlocked water body with a subterranean connection to the ocean and which has fresh water towards its surface with saline water in its deeper layers.

label: vadose cave
definition: A cave which is within a vadose zone.

label: dry woodland
definition: A dry woodland is a woodland which occurs in areas of rain shadow in a tropical marine climate,  receives very little rainfall,  typically has rapidly draining soils and trees which have adaptations to dry climates such as thick bark, small leaves, and the disposition to shed their leaves.

label: tropical marine semi-evergreen forest
definition: A semi-evergreen forest is a forest which undergoes a long dry season and, as a consequence, has a two-storey layer structure,  a dry canopy, a leaf litter layer that only decays during moist periods trees with very small leaves or which shed their leaves to conserve water and which flower during the dry season and grow during the wet season.

label: cold desert
definition: A cold desert is a desert which has hot summers and cold, dry winters with temperatures below 0 degrees Celsius

label: temperate evergreen needleleaf forest
definition: An evergreen needleleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical lowland evergreen broadleaf rain forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns with high rainfall, is located in a lowland area, and is dominated by plants which retain their leaves throughout the year.

label: temperate deciduous broadleaf forest
definition: A deciduous broadleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: temperate deciduous needleleaf forest
definition: A deciduous needleleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical deciduous broadleaf forest
definition: A deciduous broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: tropical semi-deciduous broadleaf forest
definition: A semi-deciduous broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate mixed broadleaf forest
definition: A temperate mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with broad leaves.

label: temperate mixed needleleaf forest
definition: A temperate mixed forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with needle-like leaves (e.g. conifers).

label: tropical upper montane forest
definition: A montane forest which is located in a region subject to tropical climate patterns modulated by sufficient elevation to encounter upper montane climate patterns.

label: tropical lower montane forest
definition: A montane forest which is located in a region subject to tropical climate patterns modulated by sufficient elevation to encounter lower montane climatic patterns.

label: tropical freshwater swamp forest
definition: A freshwater swamp forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate sclerophyllous dry forest
definition: A sclerophyllous forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical sclerophyllous dry forest
definition: A sclerophyllous forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate broadleaf evergreen forest
definition: A broadleaf evergreen forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: temperate freshwater swamp forest
definition: A freshwater swamp forest which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: tropical needleleaf forest
definition: A needleleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: tropical mixed needleleaf forest
definition: A mixed needleleaf forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with needle-like leaves (e.g. conifers).

label: tropical mixed broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical mixed broadleaf forest which has communities of trees composed primarily of species with broad leaves.

label: littoral zone
definition: An aquatic environment which is the part of a sea, lake, or river that is close to the shore.

label: freshwater littoral zone
definition: A freshwater littoral zone is a littoral zone which extends offshore from the shore of a freshwater body of water to the limit of occupancy of rooted plants.

label: marine eulittoral zone
definition: The eulittoral zone extends from the spring high tide line, which is rarely inundated, to the spring low tide line, which is rarely not inundated. The wave action and turbulence of recurring tides shapes and reforms cliffs, gaps, and caves, offering a huge range of habitats for sedentary organisms.

label: infralittoral zone
definition: A zone which is part of the sublittoral zone and is dominated by algae. This zone usually extends up to five metres below the low water mark.

label: circalittoral zone
definition: A zone which is part of the sublittoral zone and is dominated by sessile animals such as oysters. This zone usually begins at a depth greater than the infralittoral zone.

label: house
definition: A house is a building that provides a dwelling-place for a living entity.

label: domestic garden
definition: A garden that is associated with a human house. This association is generally one of spatial proximity or parthood.

label: building part
definition: A building part is a construction which is part of a building.

label: indoor kitchen
definition: An indoor kitchen is a room or part of a room primarily used  for cooking or food preparation, but which may have other funcitons such as dining, food storage, dishwashing, or laundry.

label: bathroom
definition: A bathroom is a room which contains a washbasin or other fixture, such as a shower or bath, used for bathing by humans.

label: living room
definition: A living room is a room in a human house which is used for social and domestic leisure activities.

label: patio
definition: A patio is a paved outdoor area, adjacent to a human house, and used for dining or recreation.

label: indoor toilet
definition: An indoor toilet is a room which contains a sanitation fixture used primarily for the disposal of human urine and faeces.

label: room
definition: A building part which is separated from other building parts by one or more interior walls and, optionally, outdoor areas by one or more exterior walls.

label: carbon nanotube enriched soil
definition: A portion of carbon nanotube enriched soil is a portion of soil with elevated levels of carbon nanotubes.

label: area of rocky shore
definition: A rocky shore is an intertidal area of a seacoast where solid rock is the predominant substrate.

label: burrow
definition: A burrow is a hole or tunnel excavated into the ground by an animal to create a space suitable for habitation, temporary refuge, or as a byproduct of locomotion

label: broadleaf forest
definition: A forest biome which contains densely packed populations or communities of broadleaf trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: mixed forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which contains densely packed populations or communities of broadleaf and coniferous trees, strongly limiting light penetration to the forest floor.

label: lava field
definition: A lava field is an expanse of flat-lying lava flows. Such features are generally composed of highly fluid basalt lava, and can extend for tens or even hundreds of miles across the underlying terrain.

label: lava flow
definition: A lava flow is a moving outpouring of lava, which is created during a non-explosive effusive eruption.

label: andesitic volcano
definition: A volcano which has been formed as a result of the eruption of andesitic lava.

label: dacitic volcano
definition: A volcano which has been formed as a result of the eruption of dacitic lava.

label: salt mass
definition: An accumulation of a salt, typically sodium chloride.

label: ravine
definition: A ravine is a small, narrow, steep-sided valley that is larger than a gully and smaller than a canyon and that is usually worn by running water.

label: roadside
definition: An environmental zone of varying area which is adjacent to a road.

label: mixed grassland
definition: A grassland which contains a mixture of tall and short grasses.

label: wet meadow ecosystem
definition: A wet meadow is a type of wetland with soils that are saturated with water for part or all of the growing season.

label: salt glacier
definition: A mass of salt which has erupted onto a planetary surface, usually through sedimentary rock.

label: building wall
definition: Building walls are bulding parts which serve to support roofs, floors and ceilings; enclose a space as part of the building envelope; give buildings form; and to provide shelter and security.

label: boundary wall
definition: A boundary wall is a constructed barrier which is usually opaque, constructed from masonry, and of greater structural strength than a fence.

label: constructed barrier
definition: A constructed barrier is a freestanding wall, berm, or fence built to limit movement of entities across a boundary.

label: fence
definition: A fence is a constructed barrier which is  generally of lighter construction than a wall and used to provide visual sectioning of spaces.

label: exterior wall
definition: An exterior wall is a building wall which separates the interior of a building from the buildings surrounding environment.

label: building envelope
definition:
A building envelope is a building part composed of those building parts which physically separate the interior of a building from its surrounding environment.
The building envelope provides resistance to air, water, heat, light, and noise transfer. The three basic elements of a building envelope are a weather barrier, air barrier, and thermal barrier.

label: ceiling
SYNONYMS: A ceiling is an overhead interior surface that covers the upper limit of a room. It is not generally considered a structural element, but a finished surface concealing the underside of the floor or roof structure above.

label: building roof
definition: A roof is the covering on the uppermost part of a building which provides protection from animals and weather, notably rain, but also heat, wind and sunlight. A roof is also the framing or structure which supports the covering

label: building floor
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A building floor is a surface layer which is part of a building and used for walking.

label: brick building floor
definition: A brick building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of brick material or is built from bricks.

label: wooden building floor
definition: A wooden building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of wood.

label: concrete building floor
definition: A concrete building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of concrete

label: sandy building floor
definition: A sandy building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of sand.

label: glass building floor
definition: A glass building floor is a building floor which is composed primarily of glass.

label: dung building floor
definition: A dung building floor is a building floor which is composed primarily of dried animal feces.

label: stone building floor
definition: A stone building floor is a building floor that is composed primarily of rock.

label: thatched exterior wall
definition: A thatched exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of thatch.

label: stone exterior wall
definition: A stone exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of rock.

label: straw exterior wall
definition: A straw exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of straw.

label: mud exterior wall
definition: A mud exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of mud.

label: pole-reinforced mud exterior wall
SYNONYMS: mud and poles exterior wall|mud and poles wall
definition: A pole-reinforced mud exterior wall is a mud exterior wall which is supported and reinforced by poles.

label: brick exterior wall
definition: A brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from bricks.

label: burnt-brick exterior wall
definition: A burnt brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from burnt bricks.

label: unburnt-brick exterior wall
definition: An unburnt brick exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from unburnt bricks.

label: salt dome
definition: A dome-shaped mass of salt formed when a thick bed of evaporite minerals (mainly salt, or halite) found at depth intrudes vertically into surrounding rock strata, forming a diapir.

label: concrete exterior wall
definition: A concrete exterior wall is an exterior wall that is composed primarily of concrete.

label: sheet-iron exterior wall
SYNONYMS: iron sheet wall|sheet iron wall|sheet-iron wall
definition: A sheet-iron exterior wall is an exterior wall that is built from sheets of iron.

label: sheet-iron building roof
SYNONYMS: iron sheet building roof|sheet iron roof|sheet-iron roof
definition: A sheet-iron building roof is a building roof that is built from sheets of iron.

label: thatched building roof
definition: A thatched building roof is a building roof that is built by thatching (or out of thatch).

label: wooden building roof
definition: A wooden building roof is a building roof that is built from wood.

label: asbestos building roof
definition: An asbestos building roof is a building roof that is built from asbestos.

label: tiled building roof
definition: A tile building roof is a building roof that is built using tiles.

label: diapir
definition: A diapir is a type of geologic intrusion in which a more mobile and ductily deformable material is forced into brittle overlying rocks due to its higher buoyancy.

label: batholith
definition: A batholith is an area of mostly continuous plutonic (igneous intrusive) rock that covers an area larger than 100 square kilometers, formed in the planetary crust, and exposed by erosion. On Earth, Batholiths are almost always made mostly of felsic or intermediate rock-types, such as granite, quartz monzonite, or diorite.

label: latrine pit
definition: A latrine pit is an artificial hole or cavity in the ground used to collect human excreta.

label: outhouse
definition: An outhouse is a small structure, separate from a main building, which covers a pit latrine or a dry toilet.

label: rock intrusion
definition: An intrusion which is primarily composed of rock which has been formed within a pre-existing fracture in a larger mass of rock.

label: sedimentary intrusion
definition: A rock intrusion which is composed primarily of sedimentary rock.

label: covered latrine
definition: A covered latrine is a building which comprises a latrine sheltered by an outhouse.

label: covered pit latrine
definition: A covered pit latrine is a building which comprises a pit latrine sheltered by an outhouse.

label: covered pit latrine with slab floor
definition: A covered pit latrine with slab is a building which comprises a pit latrine with a slab floor sheltered by an outhouse.

label: factory
definition: A factory (previously manufactory) or manufacturing plant is an industrial site, usually consisting of buildings and machinery, or more commonly a complex having several buildings, where workers manufacture goods or operate machines processing one product into another.

label: glaze ice layer
definition: A glaze ice layer is a smooth, transparent and homogeneous ice layer which coats some surface and which is formed when freezing rain or drizzle hits that surface.

label: eutrophic lake
definition: A lake which has nutrient-rich water.

label: freshwater spring
definition: A spring through which fresh water flows.

label: lentic water body
definition: A lentic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, has very little to no directed flow.

label: lotic water body
definition: A lotic water body is a water body in which the accumulated water, in its totality, is flowing.

label: chonolith
definition: A chonolith is an igneous rock intrusion of irregular shape with a demonstrable base, absent in other types of irregularly-shaped intrusions.

label: planetary landmass
definition: A landmass which is part of a planet.

label: liquid planetary surface
subClassOf [LABEL]: liquid surface of an astronomical body|planetary surface
SYNONYMS: A liquid planetary surface is a planetary surface layer where a liquid material of a planet comes into contact with atmosphere or outer space.

label: planetary crust
definition: A planetary crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet or natural satellite, which is chemically distinct from the underlying mantle.

label: planetary structural layer
definition: A planetary structural layer is laminar part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density. Planetary layers have differing physicochemical properties and composition.

label: planetary mantle
definition: A planetary mantle is a planetary layer which is an interior part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density.

label: planetary core
definition: A planetary core is the innermost structural layer or layers of a planet. The core may be entirely liquid, entirely solid, or have both liquid and solid parts.

label: liquid planetary core
definition: A liquid planetary core is a planetary core which is primarily composed of liquid material.

label: solid planetary core
definition: A solid planetary core is a planetary core which is primarily composed of solid material.

label: lithosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: planetary structural layer|solid astronomical body part
definition: A lithosphere is the outermost shell of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite that is defined by its rigid mechanical properties.

label: asthenosphere
definition: An asthenosphere is a layer of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite which is highly viscous, mechanically weak, and ductilely deforming.

label: trench
definition: A trench is a type of excavation or depression in the ground that is generally deeper than it is wide (as opposed to a wider gully or ditch), and narrow compared to its length (as opposed to a simple hole).

label: stream channel
definition: A channel of a watercourse which contains a stream.

label: ocean strait
definition: An ocean strait is a strait which connects two oceans.

label: river channel
definition: A stream channel which contains a river.

label: slum
definition: A slum is a heavily populated urban informal settlement with substandard housing in which households lack any one of the following: access to improved water, access to improved sanitation, sufficient-living area, durability of housing, or security of tenure.

label: undersea trough
definition: An undersea trough is a trough which is below a marine water body.

label: dense settlement
definition: A settlement with a high density of buildings and inhabitants.

label: igneous intrusion
definition: An igneous intrusion is a mass of rock and minerals formed when magma cools, solidifies, and undergoes fractional crystallisation without reaching the surface.

label: tuff cone
definition: A cone that is composed of consolidated volcanic ash.

label: area of open water
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of water in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: geological fracture
definition: A geological fracture is any separation in a geologic formation, such as a joint or a fault that divides a mass of rock into two or more pieces.

label: geological fault
definition: A geological fault is a planar fracture or discontinuity in a volume of rock, across which there has been significant displacement as a result of rock mass movement.

label: active geological fault
definition: An active fault is a fault that is likely to become the source of another earthquake sometime in the future. Geologists commonly consider faults to be active if there has been movement observed or evidence of seismic activity during the last 10,000 years.

label: vein
definition: A vein is a geological fracture which is filled with minerals precipitated out of an aqueous solution.

label: dike
definition: A sheet of rock that formed in a fracture in a pre-existing rock body.

label: geological joint
definition: A joint is a geological fracture which has no measureable shear displacement

label: shear fracture
definition: A geological fracture across which shear displacement has occurred

label: microfracture
definition: A microfracture is a small fracture which is found in a portion of solid material along which further fracturing tends to occur. Microfractures are considered imperfections which to pre-exist any fractures formed by the application of stress to a material.

label: polluted lake
definition: A lake which has concentrations of environmental contaminants high enough to harm the ecosystems associated with it.

label: water mass
definition: A mass of water.

label: marine water mass
definition: A mass of marine water.

label: coast
definition: A coast is the area where land meets the sea, ocean, or lake.

label: lake coast
definition: The general region of indefinite width that extends from a lake inland to the first major change in terrain features.

label: flood
definition: An unusual accumulation of water above the ground caused by high tide, heavy rain, melting snow or rapid runoff from paved areas.

label: coastal flood
definition: A coastal flood is a flood which is formed as a result of large amounts of water from marine water bodies or large lakes being transported to usually dry land by displacement processes such as high winds or seismic activity.

label: riverine flood
definition: A riverine flood is a flood which is formed as a result of a river's flow rate exceeding the capacity of its channel.

label: flash flood
definition: A flash flood is a flood formed by the rapid flooding of geomorphic low-lying areas. It may be caused by heavy rain associated with a severe thunderstorm, hurricane, tropical storm, or meltwater from ice or snow flowing over ice sheets or snowfields. Flash floods may also occur after the collapse of a natural ice or debris dam, or a human structure such as a man-made dam. Flash floods are distinguished from a regular flood by a timescale of less than six hours.

label: storm surge
definition: A storm surge is a coastal flood which is caused by low-pressure weather systems such as tropical cyclones and strong extratropical cyclones, the severity of which is affected by the shallowness and orientation of the water body relative to storm path, and the timing of tides.

label: igneous extrusion
definition: A mass of igneous rock formed when hot magma flows out (extrudes) onto a planetary surface as lava or explodes violently into the atmosphere to fall back as pyroclastics or tuff.

label: clastic dike
definition: A dike formed when sediment fills a pre-existing fracture in a mass of rock.

label: stock
definition: A stock is a discordant igneous intrusion having a surface exposure of less than 100 square kilometres. Stocks differ from batholiths only in being smaller.

label: laccolith
definition: A sheet intrusion (or concordant pluton) that has been injected between two layers of sedimentary rock. The pressure of the magma is high enough that the overlying strata are forced upward, giving the laccolith a dome or mushroom-like form with a generally planar base.

label: lopolith
definition: A large igneous intrusion which is lenticular in shape with a depressed central region.

label: phacolith
definition: A phacolith is an intrusion parallel to the bedding plane or foliation of folded country rock. More specifically, it is a typically lens-shaped intrusion that occupies either the crest of an anticline or the trough of a syncline.

label: sill
definition: A tabular sheet intrusion that has intruded between older layers of sedimentary rock, beds of volcanic lava or tuff, or along the direction of foliation in metamorphic rock.

label: habitat
definition: An environmental system which can sustain and allow the growth of an ecological population.

label: area of perennial water ice
subClassOf [LABEL]: area of perennial ice or snow
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of water ice, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: human dwelling
definition: A self-contained constructed feature used by one or more households as a home, such as a house, apartment, mobile home, houseboat or other 'substantial' structure. A dwelling typically includes nearby outbuildings, sheds etc. within the curtilage of the property, excluding any 'open fields beyond'. It has significance in relation to search and seizure, conveyancing of real property, burglary, trespass, and land use planning.

label: area of perennial snow
subClassOf [LABEL]: area of perennial ice or snow
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of snow, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of perennial ice or snow
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of snow or water ice, present throughout multiple years, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: continental crust
definition: A layer of igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks that forms continents and the areas of shallow seabed close to their shores, known as continental shelves.

label: oceanic crust
definition: Oceanic crust is the uppermost layer of the oceanic portion of a tectonic plate.

label: Mohorovicic discontinuity
definition: The Mohorovicic discontinuity, usually referred to as the Moho, is the boundary between the Earth's crust and the mantle, indicating a change in composition.

label: area of barren land
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily composed of bedrock, desert pavement, scarp rock, talus, material exposed by slides, volcanic material, glacial debris, sand, material exposed during strip mining, gravel, and other accumulations of earthen material in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: fumarole-derived ice tower
definition: A hollow tower of ice formed by the freezing of steam escaping a fumarole.

label: aeroform
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of gaseous or aerosolised material held in shape by one or more environmental processes.

label: sparsely populated settlement
definition: A settlement with a low density of buildings and inhabitants.

label: rural settlement
definition: A settlement which has lower population density than a town, city, or other urban environment and is primarily used for agricultural or pastoral activity.

label: formal settlement
definition: A settlement which has been established and is managed through officially sanctioned processes and is recognised as legal by a competent authority.

label: informal settlement
definition: A settlement which is not associated with or directed by official planning processes and which typically lacks municipal services and infrastructure such as sanitation, water services, and waste management services.

label: legal settlement
definition: A settlement on land that the inhabitants have a legal claim to.

label: illegal settlement
definition: A settlement on land that the inhabitants have no legal claim to or occupy illegally.

label: primary forest
definition: Forest which originally covered a region before changes in the environment brought about by people. (Source: PHC)

label: all season road
definition: A road which is usable across all seasons.

label: rural area
definition: An area which is outside of a town, city, or urban area. Rural areas are primarily used for agriculture or pastoralism and may contain rural settlements.

label: village
definition: A village is a clustered human settlement or community, larger than a hamlet but smaller than a town, with a population ranging from a few hundred to a few thousand. Though often located in rural areas, the term urban village is also applied to certain urban neighbourhoods. Villages are normally permanent, with fixed dwellings; however, transient villages can occur. Further, the dwellings of a village are fairly close to one another, not scattered broadly over the landscape, as a dispersed settlement.

label: oligotrophic lake
definition: A lake which has nutrient-poor water.

label: mesotrophic lake
definition: A lake with medium nutrient levels, which allow moderate productivity.

label: public infrastructure
definition: The system of public works in a country, state or region, including roads, utility lines and public buildings.

label: public road
definition: A road which is publically accessible.

label: public building
definition: A building which is publically accessible.

label: utility line
definition: A cable used to trasmit electricity from its point of production to its point of consumption.

label: public utility line
definition: A utility line which services the public power grid.

label: illegal informal settlement
definition: A populated place where groups of housing units have been constructed on land that the occupants have no legal claim to, or occupy illegally, or where dwellings are not in compliance with current planning and building regulations.

label: desert pavement
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A desert surface covered with closely packed, interlocking angular or rounded rock fragments of pebble and cobble size.

label: astronomical body part
definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

label: area of deciduous forest
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by a forest in which the majority of trees shed foliage simultaneously in response to seasonal change. The surfaces of this area (including the surface of the forest canopy) are in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: biosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which includes all the living entities within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body, as well as the non-living and dead entities with which they interact.

label: hydrosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of the combined mass of water found on, under, and over the surface of a planet.

label: pedosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of soil, subject to soil formation processes, and found on the surface of a lithosphere.

label: photosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of those parts of a star, distal from the star's core, from which light is radiated into space.

label: planetary photic zone
definition: A planetary part which is exposed, at least periodically, to light.

label: illuminated biosphere part
definition: An astronomical body part which includes those parts of a biosphere that are, at least periodically, illuminated and in which photosynthesis may occur.

label: exorheic lake
definition: A lake from which water constantly flows out of under almost all climatic circumstances, maintaining low concentrations of dissolved solid relative to endorheic lakes.

label: eaves
definition: A part of a building roof which overhangs the face of a wall and, normally, projects beyond the side of a building.

label: open eaves
definition: Overhanging eaves where the rafters and underside of the roof are visible from below.

label: closed eaves
definition: Eaves in which projecting roof members are not visible, being closed from view by boarding.

label: area of evergreen forest
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by a forest in which the majority of trees maintain their foliage despite seasonal change. The surfaces of this area (including the surface of the forest canopy) are in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: flower strip
definition: A vegetated area which includes a community of flowering plants that provide food for local pollinators.

label: flower-rich field margin strip
definition: A flower strip which is present at the margins of cultivated fields.

label: tropical marine coral reef biome
definition: A marine coral reef biome which is located in a region with a tropical climate.

label: area of mixed forest
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by a forest in which the trees are a mixture between those that lose and retain their foliage despite seasonal change. The surfaces of this area (including the surface of the forest canopy) are in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: temperate marginal sea biome
definition: A marginal sea biome which is located in a region with a temperate climate.

label: temperate mediterranean sea biome
definition: A mediterranean sea biome which is subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: marine upwelling biome
definition: A marine biome which contains communities adapted to living in an environment determined by an upwelling process.

label: tropical marine upwelling biome
definition: A marine upwelling biome which is subject to tropical climate patterns.

label: temperate marine upwelling biome
definition: A marine upwelling biome which is located in a region subject to temperate climate patterns.

label: area of dwarf scrub
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is partly covered by shrubs with ground-hugging stems or low growth habit, in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: turbulent aquatic surface layer
definition: A turbulent surface layer of a water body maintained by strong currents setting over submerged ridges or shoals or by winds opposing a current.

label: overflow structure
definition: A structure which is built into the container of a water body which allows water to flow out of the container when the volume of the water contained exceeds that of its cavity.

label: mouth of liquid discharge conduit
definition: A site at the terminus of a liquid conveyance conduit where the liquid carried is discharged into the sea or a river.

label: domestic solar panel array
definition: A solar panel array that is integrated into the power system of a human dwelling.

label: area of scrub
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by a shrubs, young trees, or stunted trees.. The surfaces of this area are in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: puddle of water
definition: A puddle is a small accumulation of water, on a surface. It can form either by pooling in a depression on the surface, or by surface tension upon a flat surface.

label: area of developed open space
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by cultivated or anthropically maintained vegetation planted for recreation, erosion control, or aesthetic purposes interspersed by constructed or manufactured objects and materials. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of developed space with low usage intensity
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by cultivated or anthropically maintained vegetation and by constructed or manufactured objects and materials covering up to approximately half its extent. Such areas are used for low intensity purposes such as accommodating collections of single-family residential units. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of developed space with medium usage intensity
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by constructed or manufactured objects and materials covering from half to three-forths of its extent and by cultivated or anthropically maintained vegetation. Such areas are used for medium intensity purposes such as accommodating dense collections of single-family residential units. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of developed space with high usage intensity
definition: An area of developed space used for high intensity purposes such as accommodating dense and multi-occupant residential, commercial, and industrial units. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of sedge- and forb-dominated herbaceous vegetation
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by sedges or forbs, possibly interpersed with grasses or grass-like plants. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of gramanoid or herbaceous vegetation
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by gramanoid or herbaceous vegetation and which is not subject to intensive management by humans. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of lichen-dominated vegetation
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by fruticose or foliose lichens and which is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of moss-dominated vegetation
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by mosses and which is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of pastureland or hayfields
subClassOf [LABEL]: anthropised terrestrial environmental zone|area of gramanoid or herbaceous vegetation
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is partly covered by planted grasses, legumes, or mixtures of grass and legumes and used for livestock grazing or the production of seed or hay crops. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of cropland
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is partly covered either by annual crops and perennial woody crops or by actively tilled land. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of woody wetland
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is partly covered by forest or shrubland vegetation and where the underlying soil or substrate is periodically saturated with or covered by water. This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: area of emergent herbaceous wetland
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by perennial herbaceous vegetation and where the underlying soil or substrate is periodically saturated with or covered by water.
