This area is in contact with an atmospheric column extending from the planetary boundary layer to the planet's exosphere with little to no physical obstruction.

label: shrimp pond
definition: A lentic water body which is used for the artificial culture of shrimp.

label: geothermally heated river
definition: A river which is heated by geothermal processes such as heat exchange with lava or hydrothermal percolation.

label: soil biocrust
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
SYNONYMS: biological soil crust|cryptobiotic soil|cryptogamic soil|microbiotic soil|microphytic soil|soil biological crust
definition: A biocrust which is formed by photosynthetic microbial assemblages colonising the surface layer of a portion of arid soil. Through their successional dynamics, these communities reduce the soil surface's albedo, impart it with stability against erosion, modify its hydrology, and promote its fertility.

label: open animal house
definition: An animal house which is only partially surrounded by a building envelope.

label: closed animal house
definition: An animal house which has a complete building envelope.

label: petting zoo
definition: A petting zoo is a zoological garden which contains domesticated non-human animals and some wild non-human animals that are docile enough for humans to touch and feed.

label: plumbing drain
definition: An artificial channel which transports unwanted water or waste liquids away from their source, either to a more useful area, a receptacle, or into sewers or stormwater mains as waste discharge to be released or processed.

label: abattoir
definition: A facility in which non-human animals are slaughtered and processed for human consumption.

label: knackery
definition: A facility in which non-human animals are slaughtered and processed, but not for human consumption.

label: day care building
definition: A building which is used to care for a human child during the working day by a person, outside the child's immediate family, other than that child's legal guardians.

label: fish processing building
definition: A building in which fish are subject to a series of operations to prepare them for human consumption.

label: nursing home
SYNONYMS: care home|convalescent home|intermediate care facility|long-term care facility|old people's home|rest home|skilled nursing facility
definition: A building in which nursing aides and skilled nurses provide care and treatment to residents who have significant difficulty coping with the required activities of daily living.

label: residential building
definition: A human house which serves as a long-term shelter for its inhabitants and within which they store personal property.

label: restaurant
definition: A building within which food and drink are prepared and served to customers in exchange for money or other goods and/or services.

label: campground
definition: A part of an ecosystem which may be or has been used for one or more overnight stays by humans sheltering in tents, camper vans, caravans, or improvised shelters.

label: dedicated campground
definition: A campground which has been modified by humans to provide and maintain facilities for camping such as fire pits, road access, latrines, and garbage bins.

label: impromptu campground
definition: A campground which has no pre-existing facilities installed or maintained by humans, usually found outside of anthropised ecosystems.

label: planetary subsurface zone
subClassOf [LABEL]: subsurface zone of an astronomical body
definition: Regions of a planet which are not exposed to the planet's atmosphere or space, often comprising parts of one or more planetary structural layers.

label: continental subsurface zone
definition: A region which overlaps parts of one or more planetary structural layers which are located below a continental landmass.

label: vegetated hill
definition: A hill which has a surface that is partially or wholly covered by plant communities.

label: lichen woodland
definition: A woodland which has an understory partially covered by lichen mats and tundra-like vegetation.

label: alpine tree line ecotone
definition: A tree line ecotone across which trees cease to grow due to the low temperatures or duration of snow cover that occur at increased elevations above mean sea level.

label: constructed swimming pool
definition: A construction which is designed to hold water in which humans may swim or perform other leisure activities.

label: private swimming pool
definition: A constructed swimming pool which is owned by a non-governmental legal entity or a collective of such entities.

label: public swimming pool
definition: A constructed swimming pool which is owned by a governmental or state entity.

label: water intake
definition: A hydraulic-engineering installation which transports water - in specified amounts, of a specified quality, and in accordance with a water-consumption plan - from a source of supply into a conduit.

label: cafeteria
definition: A building which provides the site for food services with little or no waiting staff furnishing table service.

label: delicatessen
definition: A food shop which sells a selection of food products that are not typical dietary components of the human population it is co-located with.

label: take-out restaurant
definition: A restaurant which provides prepared meals or other food products that the purchaser must eat off its premises.

label: kiosk
definition: A booth with an open window on one side.

label: food kiosk
definition: A kiosk from which food products are sold.

label: channel of an intermittent river
definition: A channel of an intermittent stream which contains a river when water supply exceeds evapotranspiration and bed seepage.

label: channel of an intermittent stream
subClassOf [LABEL]: container of an intermittent water body
definition: A channel through which a directional flow of water periodically occurs, ceasing when bed seepage or evapotranspiration exceed the available water supply.

label: technosphere
definition: A part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the entities which have been constructed or manufactured by humans or their technology and which are within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body.

label: grocery store
definition: A food shop in which food products are the primary offer for sale or trade.

label: fairground
definition: A part of an ecosystem which has been allocated to host a gathering of people for multiple entertainment or commercial activities.

label: agricultural fairground
definition: A fairground which is used to exhibit agricultural technology, livestock, and farm-related activity.

label: market
definition: A part of an ecosystem where people gather for the purchase and sale of provisions, livestock, and other goods.

label: ethnic food shop
SYNONYMS: ethnic food store|ethnic speciality shop|ethnic speciality store
definition: A food shop in which the food products on offer are restricted to those produced in a region and cultural setting other than that of the shop's locality.

label: dry river
definition: A dry stream channel through which a river had flowed, but now contains no appreciable accumulations of water.

label: hypereutrophic lake
definition: A lake which is composed primarily of water with very high nutrient concentrations.

label: hypersaline lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of water with a concentration of dissolved salts greater than that of ocean water.

label: humic lake
definition: A lake which is composed primarily water with high concentrations of humic substances and organic acids, resulting in brown- or tea-coloured colouration.

label: natural lake
definition: A lake which has formed as the result of processes that are not or are only minimally driven by human activity.

label: soil environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by soil.

label: oceanic subsurface zone
definition: A region which overlaps parts of one or more planetary structural layers which are located below an oceanic plate.

label: caldera lake
definition: A lake which is contained within a caldera.

label: crater lake
definition: A lake contained within a crater.

label: meteorite lake
SYNONYMS: meteorite crater lake|meteorite impact crater lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a crater formed by a meteorite impact.

label: impact crater lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a crater formed by an impact event.

label: impact crater
definition: A crater which was formed as a result of the impact of one astronomical body on another.

label: anoxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of anoxic water.

label: lake with an anoxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of anoxic water.

label: lake with a hypoxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of hypoxic water.

label: hypoxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of hypoxic water.

label: oxic lake
definition: A lake which is primarily composed of oxic water.

label: lake with an oxic hypolimnion
definition: A lake which has a hypolimnion composed primarily of oxic water.

label: tectonic lake
definition: A lake which is contained in a depression formed by the deformation and resulting lateral and vertical movements of a lithosphere.

label: tectonic plate
definition: A part of a lithosphere which is separated by other such parts by geographic faults or similar geomorphological discontinuities.

label: rift zone
definition: A compound astronomical body part in which extensional tectonic processes occur and where the lithosphere is being pulled apart.

label: aeolian lake
definition: A lake which fills a basin that has been dammed by wind-blown sand,  formed between sand dunes oriented by winds; or formed by wind action under previously arid paleoenvironments.

label: landslide lake
definition: A lake which fills a depression where drainage is blocked by solid material transported by a landslide.

label: rockslide lake
definition: A lake which fills a depression where drainage is blocked by solid material transported by a rockslide.

label: Karman vortex street
SYNONYMS: Krmn vortex street|von Krmn vortex street
definition: A succession of swirling vortices caused by the unsteady separation of flow of a fluid around one or more blunt bodies.

label: fossil worm burrow
definition: A channel which was formed as a result of an annelid burrowing through soil, where organic residues lining the burrow have subsequently initiated fossilization.

label: cirrus homogenitus cloud
definition: A cloud which is cirriform and is formed by condensation events centred on an aircraft's contrail.

label: cirrus cloud
definition: A cloud which 1) has been shaped into detached fibrous filaments, 2) is almost exclusively composed of ice crystals, 3) is located in the high level of the atmosphere (high tage).

label: arable land
definition: Land which is regularly manipulated by human activities, such as plowing or tilling, in order to grow crops.

label: pasturable land
definition: Land which hosts a community of herbaceous plants - such as grasses and forbs - upon which animals may graze.

label: tended pasturable land
definition: Pasturable land which is maintained by human activities in order to provide grazing oppoturnities for livestock.

label: arable or pasturable land
definition: Land which either hosts plant communities upon which animals may graze has been manipulated by tilling, ploughing, or other human activity for the purposes of seed sowing or planting crops.

label: acidic soil
definition: Soil which has increased levels of molecules or ions capable of donating a hydron (proton or hydrogen ion) to other chemical entities, or, alternatively, capable of forming covalent bonds with other chemicals via the acceptance of an electron pair, resulting in a bulk pH measurement of less than 7.

label: water-based planetary surface
subClassOf [LABEL]: liquid astronomical body part|liquid planetary surface
SYNONYMS: A liquid planetary surface which is composed primarily of water.

label: terrestrial environmental zone
definition: An environmental zone which is bounded by material parts of a land mass or the atmosphere or space adjacent to it.

label: anthropised terrestrial environmental zone
definition: A terrestrial zone which is bounded by constructed, manufactured, or other anthropogenic material entities.

label: marine environmental zone
definition: An astronomical body part which is part of a marine environment.

label: grassland ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem in which grasses (Graminae) are the dominant form of vegetation and determine the system's structure and dynamics.

label: ranch
definition: An area of land used for the herding and grazing of livestock.

label: swamp area
definition: An area of wetland which overlaps a swamp ecosystem.

label: office building
definition: A commercial building which contains parts used as workplaces primarily for administrative and managerial workers.

label: commercial building
definition: A building which is primarily used to facilitate the buying or selling of goods or services.

label: office
definition: A building part within which administrative work is done by an organisations users in order to support and realise the objectives of that organization.

label: terrestrial natural environment
definition: A natural environment which is located on a land mass.

label: aquatic natural environment
definition: A natural environment which is within a water body.

label: tropical marginal sea biome
definition: A marginal sea biome which is located in a region with a tropical climate.

label: woodland canopy
definition: A canopy which is part of a woodland ecosystem.

label: crop canopy
definition: A canopy which is composed of the aboveground portion, or crowns, of a community of crop plants.

label: forest ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by communities of plants with a tree growth form and in which members of those communities form continuous or discontinuous regions of canopy cover.

label: cropland ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which 1) is determined by communities of annual crops, perennial woody crops, or by actively tilled land, 2) is primarily used for agricultural activity, and 3) contains no village or larger human settlement.

label: woodland ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by communities of plants with a tree growth form and in which members of those communities are spaced sufficiently far apart to allow sunlight to illuminate the understory.

label: coastal shrimp pond
definition: A shrimp pond which is embedded in a coastal water body.

label: saline shrimp pond water
definition: Saline water which is derived from sea water and used during the cultivation of crustaceans.

label: area of developed space
definition: An area of a planet's surface which is primarily covered by constructed or manufactured objects and materials, possibly interspersed with cultivated or anthropically maintained vegetation.

label: constructed pavement
definition: A construction which comprises a durable surface layer overlying a solid surface intended to sustain vehicular or foot traffic.

label: water ice layer
definition: A solid layer which is primarily composed of some water-based ice.

label: asphalt road
definition: A road which is primarily composed of asphalt.

label: concrete road
definition: A road which is primarily composed of concrete.

label: sidewalk
definition: A constructed pavement which is built on the side of a road and intended for foot traffic.

label: driveway
definition: A road which is used for local access to one or more structures, and is privately owned and maintained by an individual or group.

label: paved parking lot
definition: A constructed pavement which is used for parking vehicles.

label: bush area
definition: A vegetated area which has not been cleared or is sparsely settled, usually scrub-covered or forested

label: area of low atmospheric pressure
definition: A gaseous part of an atmosphere in which gases have reduced atmospheric pressure.

label: aquatic estuarine layer
definition: A layer of liquid that is part of an estuary.

label: estuarine coastal surface layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: aquatic estuarine layer|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: oasis
definition: An oasis is a vegetated area located in a desert, supplied with water from a water source which it surrounds, and surrounded by arid soil, sand, or rock.

label: vegetated area
definition: A vegetated area is a geographic feature which has ground cover dominated by plant communities.

label: hydroform
definition: A liquid astronomical body part which is primarily composed of a continuous volume of liquid water and is held in shape or sustained by an environmental process.

label: estuarine coastal upper water column
subClassOf [LABEL]: aquatic estuarine layer|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine coastal pycnocline
definition: A pycnocline which is part of an estuarine water body, spanning from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine coastal lower water column
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuarine bed and from the shore to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine open water surface layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: aquatic estuarine layer|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine open water upper water column
subClassOf [LABEL]: aquatic estuarine layer|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal surface layer
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from the land-water interface to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal upper water column
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from the land-water interface to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: saline water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of saline water.

label: fresh water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of freshwater, with low solute content.

label: brackish water body
definition: A body of water which is primarily composed of brackish water.

label: estuarine open water lower water column
definition: A layer of estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters to end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine open water pycnocline
definition: A pycnocline which is part of an estuarine water body, spanning from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal pycnocline
definition: An estuarine coastal pycnocline which is composed primarily of fresh tidal water.

label: estuarine tidal riverine coastal lower water column
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuarine bed and from the land-water interface to a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water surface layer
definition: A layer of fresh, tidal estuarine water which extends a few centimeters from the surface of the water column towards the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water upper water column
subClassOf [LABEL]: estuarine open water upper water column
definition: A layer of fresh, tidal estuarine water which extends from the surface of the water column to the pycnocline or mid-depth and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters until the end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water pycnocline
definition: An estuarine open water pycnocline which is composed primarily of fresh tidal water.

label: estuarine tidal riverine open water lower water column
definition: A layer of fresh estuarine water which extends from an estuarine pycnocline or mid-depth to the estuary bed and from a fiat boundary where the estuary bed below the water column reaches a depth of 4 meters to end of the estuary most distal from the coast.

label: anchor ice
definition: An ice mass which is attached to a bed underneath a body of water.

label: marine tidal flow
definition: A marine current which is maintained by a tidal flow process.

label: riverine anchor ice
definition: Anchor ice which is attached to a riverbed.

label: diurnal marine tidal flow zone
definition: A marine zone in which ocean waters undergo a diurnal (once per day) tidal oscillation - with one high and one low tide per day - due to the supression of a second daily oscillation by the geometry of the ocean basin and obstructions presented by land masses.

label: semi-diurnal marine tidal flow zone
definition: A marine tidal flow zone in which ocean waters undergo a semi-diurnal (twice per day) tidal oscillation - with two high and two low tides per day of roughly equal amplitude.

label: marine tidal flow zone
definition: An environmental zone in which varying gravitational forces from astronomical bodies, combined with the rotation of the astronomical body containing the zone, cause marine waters to undergo periodic depth oscillations (tides).

label: freshwater seep riverine anchor ice
SYNONYMS: fresh water seep riverine anchor ice|fresh water seep riverine bottom-fast ice|freshwater seep riverine bottom-fast ice
definition: Anchor ice which is attached to a riverbed where a river flows into a marine water body and which is formed by the freezing of freshwater seeping out of the riverbed's sediments.

label: floating ice mass
definition: An ice mass which is suspended in a water body, being sufficiently buoyant for part of the mass to breach the surface of that water body.

label: desert
definition: A landform which has been rendered barren or partially barren by environmental extremes, especially by low rainfall, and which loses more liquid water by evapotranspiration than is supplied by precipitation.

label: Paramo
definition: An alpine tundra ecosystem which exists above the continuous timberline but below the permanent snowline on elevated land in tropical regions.

label: tidal mangrove shrubland
definition: A shrubland biome which is densely vegetated by dwarf or short mangroves (and associates) that are generally less than 6 meters in height, is tidally influenced,  is located in tropical or subtropical areas.

label: tundra ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which 1) typically has monthly average temperatures below 10 degrees Celsius 2) has a low evapotranspiration ratio 3) is dominated by treeless terrain, covered by communities of low-growing vegetation such as dwarf shrubs, sedges and grasses, mosses, and lichens, 4) contains areas of soil underlain by permafrost with a thin active layer and 5) occurs in both polar and alpine regions (i.e., both high latitudes and high altitudes), and 5) does not have permanent snow or ice cover.

label: alpine tundra ecosystem
definition: A tundra ecosystem which exists at high altitudes and where vegetation is stunted due to low temperatures and high winds.

label: marine faunal bed
definition: A marine bed which is covered by animals which have benthic habitats, including attached, clinging, sessile, infaunal, burrowing, laying, interstitial, and slow-moving animals, but not animals that have created substrate.

label: marine bed
definition: A submerged bed which underlies a marine water body.

label: mussel bed
definition: A marine faunal bed which is dominated by mussels of the Mytilus or Modiolus genera either 1) resting on the sediment surface, 2)  partially embedded in the sediment, 3) attached to conspecifics (by using their byssal threads), or 4) attached to a piece of gravel in slightly gravelly fine sediments.

label: neritic mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is located on a shelf (i.e. in the neritic zone) and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: oceanic mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is present in the depths beyond (offshore relative to) the continental shelf and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: area of attached mussel assemblages
definition: An area which is dominated by dense accumulations of mussels attached to a substrate other than conspecifics, including the associated faunal communities and predators present on the mussels (e.g., starfish).

label: area of attached Modiolus assemblages
definition: An area which is dominated by dense accumulations of mussels, of the genus Modiolus, attached to a substrate other than conspecifics, including the associated faunal communities and predators present on the mussels (e.g., starfish).

label: Bathymodiolus-dominated oceanic mussel reef
definition: An oceanic mussel reef which is primarily settled by mussels of the genus Bathymodiolus and primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells

label: mussel reef
definition: A marine reef which is primarily composed of self-adhered or conglomerated mussel shells.

label: oceanic mussel bed
definition: A mussel bed which is located in benthic regions beyond (offshore to) a continental shelf.

label: neritic mussel bed
definition: A mussel bed which is located in benthic regions that are part of a continental shelf.

label: Bathymodiolus-dominated oceanic mussel bed
definition: An oceanic mussel bed which has mussel communities dominated by members of the genus Bathymodiolus.

label: abyssal clay
definition: Clay which is part of an abyssal plain.

label: ultisol
definition: A soil which has high mineral content and which contain no calcareous material, have less than 10% weatherable minerals its surface layer, and have less than 35% base saturation throughout its volume.

label: laboratory facility
definition: A research facility in which systems of manufactured products control internal conditions and in which scientific or technological research, experiments, and measurement may be performed.

label: cirrocumulus cloud
definition: A cloud which 1) has been shaped into structural elements resembling grains or ripples, 2) is almost exclusively composed of ice crystals, 3) is located in the high level of the atmosphere (high tage).

label: cirrostratus cloud
definition: A cloud which 1) occurs in the form of a smooth or fibrous veil, 2) is composed of few small ice crystals, 3) is located in the high level of the atmosphere (high tage).

label: cirrus fibratus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which occurs as a detached unit or a thin veil and consists of nearly straight or irregularly curved filaments that do not terminate in hooks or tufts.

label: cirrus uncinus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which does not have grey parts and which is often shaped like a comma, terminating at its highest point in a hook, or in a tuft, the upper part of which is not in the form of a rounded protuberance.

label: cirrus spissatus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which 1) is structurally organised in patches, 2) is sufficiently dense to appear greyish when viewed towards the local star and 3) may veil, the local star, obscure its outline, or even hide it entirely.

label: cirrostratus fibratus cloud
definition: A cirrostratus cloud which occurs as a detached unit or a thin veil and consists of nearly straight or irregularly curved filaments that do not terminate in hooks or tufts.

label: cirrus castellanus cloud
definition: A cirrus cloud which 1) has linearly arranged cumuliform protuberances which resemble crenellated turrets or towers, some of which are taller than they are wide in some portion of their upper parts, 2) possess a lower region or base which connects these protuberances.

label: cirrocumulus castellanus cloud
definition: A cirrocumulus cloud which 1) has linearly arranged cumuliform protuberances which resemble crenellated turrets or towers, some of which are taller than they are wide in some portion of their upper parts, 2) possess a lower region or base which connects these protuberances.

label: Calyptra habitat
definition: A habitat which supports the persistence and growth of a population of Calyptra moths and which overlaps mesic meadows and edges and clearings in vegetated areas.

label: terrestrial mountain
definition: A mountain which is located on land and which is bounded by an atmosphere or outer space.

label: polar mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a polar environment.

label: temperate mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a temperate environment.

label: tropical mountain
definition: A mountain that is part of a tropical environment.

label: cloud forest
definition: A montane forest ecosystem which 1) is evergreen, 2) present on mountains where there is frequent cloud and mist cover, 3) which has a large proportion of ferns and mosses in its plant communities, growing on all tree trunks and branches present in the ecosystem, and 3) harvests aerosolised water and adds it to the terrestrial water supply.

label: high-elevation mountain
definition: A mountain which has a maximum elevation greater than 2500 metres above sea level.

label: mid-elevation mountain
definition: A mountain which has a maximum elevation between 300 and 2499 metres above sea level and slopes greater than or equal to two degrees of inclination.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 1 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation greater than 4500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 2 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 3500 and 4500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 3 mountain
definition: A high-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 2500 and 3500 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 4 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 1500 and 2499 metres above sea level and a slope greater than or equal to two degrees.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 5 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 1000 and 1499 metres above sea level and either 1) a slope greater than or equal to five degrees or 2) a local elevation range, within a 7 kilometre radius, of greater than 300 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 6 mountain
definition: A mid-elevation mountain which has a maximum elevation between 300 and 999 metres above sea level and a local elevation range, within a 7 kilometre radius, of greater than 300 metres above sea level.

label: UNEP-WCMC class 7 mountain
definition: An elevated inner basin or plateau surrounded by mountains, but not - itself - a mountain.

label: intertidal ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which overlaps those areas of the foreshore and seabed that are exposed to the air at low tide and submerged at high tide.

label: body of liquid
definition: A liquid astronomical body part which is continuous and is delimited by physical discontinuities or non-liquid boundaries.

label: liquid astronomical body part
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of liquid material.

label: gaseous astronomical body part
subClassOf [LABEL]: compound astronomical body part|fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of gaseous material.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of fluid.

label: domestic building
definition: A building which is primarily used for the long-term habitation of humans.

label: public prison
SYNONYMS: correctional facility|detention center|gaol|jail|penitentiary|public correctional center|public correctional centre|public correctional facility|public detention center|public detention centre|public gaol|public jail|public lock-up|public penitentiary|public remand center|public remand centre|remand center
definition: A prison facility which is owned and operated by a state.

label: tornado
definition: A tornado is an aeroform consisting of at least one rapidly rotating column of air that is in contact with both the surface of an astronomical body and pendant from within or beneath a cumulonimbus or cumulus cloud.

label: surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer where the solid or liquid material of an astronomical body comes into contact with an atmosphere or outer space.

label: fire whirl
definition: A fire whirl is a whirlwind induced by the contraction and rotation of intense, rising heat and turbulent, eddying air masses resulting from a large fire and made up of a core of burning matter surrounded by a rotating pocket of air.

label: multiple vortex tornado
definition: A tornado which comprises two or more columns of spinning air rotating about their own axis and at the same time around a common center.

label: landspout
SYNONYMS: dust-tube tornado|fair weather waterspout on land|land spout
definition: A tornado which a) is not associated with a mesocyclone and is thus relatively weak and short-lived, b) is centred on a small, smooth condensation funnel which often does not reach the planetary surface, and c) forms a distinctively laminar cloud of dust when it makes contact with the land.

label: waterspout
definition: A tornado which connects a cumulus or cumulonimbus cloud to a body of water, often transporting water from that water body along the spiraling winds constituting  its vortex.

label: spur
definition: A slope of land descending laterally from a hill, mountain or main crest of a ridge.

label: intrusion
definition: A mass of environmental material which has been formed as the result of its transport into an existing mass of another material.

label: flattened elevation
definition: An elevation which is flattened across its highest surface.

label: alpine tundra biome
definition: A tundra biome which exists at high altitudes and where vegetation - dominated by a few species of dwarf shrubs, a few grasses, sedges, lichens, and mosses - is stunted due to low temperatures and high winds.

label: ice calf
definition: An ice mass which has calved off an larger mass of ice.

label: floating ice calf
definition: An ice calf which is suspended in a water mass, being partially exposed to an atmosphere.

label: anchored ice calf
definition: An ice calf which is frozen to the bed of an ocean or other water body.

label: terrestrial ice calf
definition: An ice calf which rests on land.

label: drift ice mass
definition: A floating mass of ice which is 1) unattached to land or land-fast ice and 2) moved by the action of winds or currents.

label: drifting sea ice mass
definition: A drift ice mass which is composed primarily of sea ice.

label: area of pack ice
definition: An area in which masses of drift ice aggregate such that they cover a minimum of 7/10ths-8/10ths of the surface the water body they are floating in.

label: area of sea ice
definition: An environmental zone that overlaps that part of a water body covered or partially covered by sea ice.

label: area of drift ice
definition: An area in which masses of drift ice aggregate such that they cover less than 7/10ths of the surface the water body they are floating in.

label: fast ice
definition: A mass of sea ice which 1) is less than 2 meters in thickness and 2) forms along the coast, where it is attached to the shore, to an ice wall, to an ice front, or between shoals or grounded icebergs.

label: frozen land
definition: Land which is below the freezing point of water.

label: hard-frozen soil
definition: Frozen soil which is firmly cemented by water ice, is subject to brittle failure, and exhibits practically no consolidation under load.

label: frozen soil
definition: Soil which is below the freezing point of water.

label: plastic-frozen soil
definition: Frozen soil which is cemented by water ice but has viscous properties due to its high, unfrozen water content and therefore will compress and deform under load.

label: friable-frozen soil
definition: Frozen soil which has very low total water content and is not cemented by ice; its compressibility is the same as that of unfrozen soils having the same composition, total water content and density.

label: glacier snout
definition: An ice mass which constitutes that part of a glacier which has the lowest elevation.

label: water ice core
definition: An ice mass which has been drilled from an accumulation of snow and ice that has built up over many years and that has recrystallized and has trapped air bubbles from previous time periods.

label: sea ice field
definition: An ice field which is primarily composoed of sea ice floes greater than 10 kilometers across.

label: glacier ice field
definition: An ice field which is constituted by a continuous accumulation of snow and glacier ice that completely fills a mountain basin or covers a low-relief mountain plateau.

label: tabular iceberg
definition: An iceberg which 1) has a flat upper surface, 2) is derived from an ice shelf, ice tongue, or floating tidewater glacier via detachment.

label: floeberg
definition: An ice mass which is composed of a large amount of sea ice in the form of a hummock or a group of such hummocks, frozen together and separated from any surrounding ice by sea water.

label: sea ice mass
definition: An ice mass which is composed primarily of sea ice.

label: sea ice hummock
definition: An elevation which is formed by pressure at the point of contact between ice floes, resulting in a conglomeration of broken ice.

label: frost-formed hummock
definition: A hummock which is primarily composed of soil that has been pushed up by frost action.

label: water ice surface layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: surface of an astronomical body|water ice layer
definition: An ice surface layer which is primarily composed of water ice.

label: iceberg
definition: An ice mass which has broken away from a larger ice mass on land, such as a glacier or ice shelf, and may be either afloat or aground.

label: land ice mass
definition: An ice mass which has formed over land.

label: sea-ice lead
definition: An ice lead which occurs in a marine water body and is bounded by sea ice.

label: ice lead
subClassOf [LABEL]: surface layer of a water body
definition: A surface layer of a water body which has been formed as the result of surface ice fracturing and moving apart.

label: flaw lead
definition: An ice lead between a mass of fast ice and a mass of pack ice.

label: shore lead
definition: An ice lead which occurs between the shore and pack ice.

label: surface layer of a water body
definition: A water surface that is part of a water body.

label: frozen lead
definition: An ice lead within which new, nilas, and young ice has formed.

label: pack ice mass
definition: A drift ice mass which has an ice concentration above or equal to 7/10: which covers 70% or more of a given area of a water body.

label: cryopeg
definition: A layer which is composed of ground that 1) remains unfrozen due to increased solute concentration and 2) is present within a mass of permafrost.

label: frost heave
definition: An elevation which is formed as an ice mass forms under soil, resulting in upwards deformation of the land surface.

label: terrestrial ecoregion
definition: An ecoregion which is located on a landmass.

label: sea surface layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: surface layer of a water body
definition: A surface layer which is part of an ocean or sea.

label: forest floor
definition: Land which is present within a forest biome.

label: water current
definition: A hydroform which is maintained by a continuous, directed movement of water, generated by disequilibria in a water mass.

label: cryospheric layer
definition: A layer which is part of a cryosphere.

label: active layer in a cryosphere
definition: A layer of environmental material which is subject to freeze-thaw cycles.

label: bare soil
definition: Soil which is directly exposed to the atmosphere - with no intervening layer of plant life or other cover - and thus the effects of weathering and erosion.

label: mass of ice and snow
definition: A object which is composed primarily of water-based snow and ice.

label: polar tundra ecosystem
definition: A tundra ecosystem which is subject to polar climatic conditions.

label: polymetallic nodule ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which is determined by the presence of rounded mineral concretions primarily composed of manganese hydroxides on the seafloor.

label: frost-susceptible soil
definition: Soil in which segregated ice will form (causing frost heave) under the required conditions of moisture supply and temperature.

label: gaseous part of an atmosphere
definition: That part of an atmosphere which is composed of gaseous material.

label: colloid suspended in a hydrosphere
definition: A colloidal suspension which is dispersed through a part of a hydrosphere.

label: suspended colloidal sediment
definition: Colloidal sediment which is suspended in a part of the hydrosphere.

label: well-mixed estuary
definition: An estuary in which mixing by tidal forcing exceeds the force of riverine output, resulting in thorough homogenisation of the estuary's water column and the disappearance of a vertical salinity gradient and the freshwater-seawater boundary.

label: soil cryoturbate
definition: A mass of soil moved or disturbed by frost action.

label: atmospheric frontal zone
definition: Part of an atmosphere which contains a weather front, bounded by frontal surfaces.

label: open cage mariculture facility
definition: A construction which contains the equipment needed to perform mariculture in open cages - permitting the exchange of material with the surrounding marine water.

label: marine cline
definition: A cline which is part of a marine water body.

label: plume
definition: A fluid astronomical body part which is plume shaped.

label: thrust fault
definition: A fault across which older rocks are pushed above (away from the core of an astronomical body) younger rocks.

label: blind thrust fault
definition: A thrust fault which does not breach the surface of an astronomical body.

label: subsurface zone of an astronomical body
definition: An environmental zone which includes those regions of an astronomical body which are not exposed to its atmosphere or space.

label: desert ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem in which the composition, structure, and function of resident ecological assemblages are primarily determined by a desert.

label: part of a landmass
definition: A solid astronomical body part which is part of the landmass of that body.

label: landmass
definition: A large continuous area of land, either surrounded by sea or contiguous with another landmass.

label: liquid surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface of an astronomical body which is part of a water body present on that body.

label: compound astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is composed of a continuous medium bearing liquid, gaseous, and solid material in variable quantities.

label: land
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of solid material and is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.

label: inland sea
definition: A sea which shalowly covers central areas of continents during periods of high sea level that result in marine transgressions.

label: terrestrial ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem which primarily occurs on land.

label: mediterranean forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which includes communities adapted to 1) hot to warm, dry summers, 2) mild to cold, rainy winters, and 3) the influence of large, usually marine, bodies of water.

label: tropical broadleaf forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to tropical climate conditions.

label: subtropical broadleaf forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to subtropical climate conditions.

label: temperate broadleaf forest
definition: A broadleaf forest which is subject to temperate climate conditions.

label: temperate mixed forest
definition: A mixed forest which is subject to temperate climatic conditions.

label: tropical mixed forest
definition: A mixed forest which is subject to tropical climatic conditions.

label: tropical mixed forest biome
subClassOf [LABEL]: mixed forest biome|tropical biome|tropical mixed forest
definition: A tropical mixed forest in which dominant ecological communities have reached their climax successional state.

label: tropical dry broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical broadleaf forest which 1) s subject to a year-round warm climate 2) may receive several hundred centimeters or rain per year and 3) are subject to long dry seasons which last several months.

label: tropical moist broadleaf forest
definition: A tropical broadleaf forest which 1) has low variability in annual temperature, 2) high levels of rainfall (>200 centimeter annually), and 3) has tree communities dominated by semi-evergreen and evergreen species.

label: subtropical dry broadleaf forest
definition: A subtropical broadleaf forest which 1) s subject to a year-round warm climate 2) may receive several hundred centimeters or rain per year and 3) are subject to long dry seasons which last several months.

label: subtropical moist broadleaf forest
definition: A subtropical broadleaf forest which 1) has low variability in annual temperature, 2) high levels of rainfall (>200 centimeter annually), and 3) has tree communities dominated by semi-evergreen and evergreen species.

label: tropical forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which is subject to tropical climate conditions.

label: subtropical forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which is subject to subtropical climate conditions.

label: temperate forest
definition: A forest ecosystem which is subject to temperate climate conditions.

label: tropical grassland
definition: A grassland ecosystem which is subject to tropical climatic conditions.

label: subtropical grassland
definition: A grassland which is subject to subtropical climatic conditions.

label: mediterranean grassland
definition: A grassland which is subject to mediterranean climatic conditions.

label: bubble plume
definition: A plume which is composed primarily of bubbles.

label: human settlement
definition: An anthropised ecosystem which is determined by the presence of humans and their constructions.

label: tropical biome
definition: A biome which is subject to tropical climatic conditions.

label: temperate biome
definition: A biome which is subject to temperate climatic conditions.

label: subtropical biome
definition: A biome which is subject to subtropical climatic conditions.

label: mediterranean biome
definition: A biome which is subject to mediterranean climatic conditions.

label: subpolar biome
definition: A biome which is subject to subpolar climatic conditions.

label: alpine biome
definition: A biome which is subject to alpine altitudinal conditions.

label: montane biome
definition: A biome which is subject to montane altitudinal conditions.

label: subalpine biome
definition: A biome which is subject to subapline altitudinal conditions.

label: arid biome
definition: A biome which is subject to arid environmental conditions.

label: volcanic soil
definition: An andosol which derives its silica content from glass and tephra ejected during a volcanic eruption.

label: geothermally active field
definition: A field in which geothermal processes occur.

label: hydrothermal field
definition: A geothermally active field within which geothermally heated aqueous fluids are discharged from the the surface of a rocky planet.

label: gas well
definition: A well which has been drilled in order to extract natrual gas from subterranean reservoirs and bring it to the surface.

label: pit
definition: A depression in the ground resembling a hole or cavity, either natural or anthropogenic.

label: manure pit
definition: A pit which is used for the collection and storage of manure.

label: hatchery
definition: A construction in which eggs are hatched under artificial conditions.

label: poultry hatchery
definition: A hatchery in which the eggs of poultry are hatched under artificial conditions.

label: surface landform
definition: A landform which occurs on the surface of an astronomical body.

label: submerged landform
definition: A landform which is submerged underneath a body of liquid.

label: landform
definition: A solid astronomical body part which has been formed from and is composed primarily of the matter of that astronomical body.

label: calcic spring
definition: A mineral spring through which water with elevated concentrations of calcium hydroxide flows.

label: lithia spring
definition: A mineral spring through which water with elevated concentrations of lithium salts flows.

label: chalybeate spring

definition: Soil which has properties that restrict a pathogen's ability to establish itself, persist, or cause disease that results in long-term harm.

label: eutrophic pond
definition: A pond which has nutrient-rich water.

label: experimental forest ecosystem
definition: A forest ecosystem which is designated for research.

label: fermentation pit
definition: A pit which has been constructed for use in fermentation processes that will yield alcoholic spirits.

label: marine lake
definition: A lake which is connected to a marine water body via tunnels or cracks in the soil.

label: meromictic pond
definition: A pond which has layers of water that do not intermix.

label: raceway pond
definition: A pond which humans have constructed for the cultivation of algae.

label: yard
definition: An anthropogenic geographic feature which consists of land immediately adjacent to a building or a group of buildings.

label: fountain
definition: A human construction which supplies drinking water by squirting it into a basin or jets water into the air for a decorative or dramatic effect.

label: tube well
definition: A water well in which a long, 100200 millimetres-wide, stainless steel tube or pipe is bored into an underground aquifer to lift water using a pump.

label: halite
definition: A salt mass which consists of isometric crystals of sodium chloride (NaCl).

label: neonatal intensive care unit
definition: An intensive care unit (ICU) specializing in the care of ill or premature newborn infants.

label: ice wedge
definition: A geological fracture which is formed during winter months by a narrow or thin piece of ice.

label: cyanobacterial bloom
definition: A feature which arises from a rapid multiplication of cyanobacteria, causing marked visible discoloration of the water.

label: ophiolites
definition: A planetary structural layer which consists of oceanic crust and the underlying upper mantle and has been uplifted and exposed above sea level.

label: contaminated land
definition: Land which has elevated levels of some contaminants or substances that are potentially hazardous to health or the environment.

label: oil mill
definition: An industrial building in which oil-bearing seeds or vegetable materials are crushed and pressed with a grinding mill in order to extract oils.

label: waste stabilization pond
definition: A human construction which confines wastewater in a depression enclosed by earthen structures.

label: oil refinery
definition: An industrial building in which crude oil is transformed and refined into useful products.

label: industrial park
definition: A human construction which is used for the purpose of industrial development.

label: mofetta
definition: A geological fracture, found near volacnoes in the final phase of thier activity, chiefly discharging carbon dioxide and possibly other vapors.

label: greenhouse
definition: A human construction which provides regulated climatic conditions for the growth of plants and whose walls and roof are made chiefly of transparent material, such as glass.

label: alcohol fermentation pit
definition: A fermentation pit which is constructed to facilitate the fermentation of alcoholic substances.

label: clay fermentation pit
definition: A fermentation pit which is constructed from clay.

label: artificial pond
definition: A pond which has been constructed by humans or their technologies.

label: artificial satellite
definition: A human construction that has intentionally been placed into orbit.

label: stream pool
definition: A water body which is created in a stream by local scour or impoundment and has some structural control.

label: stream run
definition: A hydroform which is that part of a stream where water flows swiftly and uniformly with low surface water agitation.

label: step pool
definition: A stream pool which is formed as a result of high-gradient, steep streams where water cascades over a rock or woody snag.

label: stream water
definition: Water which is part of a stream.

label: freshwater stream
definition: A stream which is composed primarily of fresh water.

label: freshwater stream biome
definition: A freshwater stream ecosystem which is undergoing climactic ecological succession.

label: freshwater stream ecosystem
definition: An ecosystem in which the composition, structure, and function of resident ecological assemblages are primarily determined by a freshwater stream.

label: lake water
definition: Water which is part of a lake.

label: soil organic matter
definition: Organic material in soil, which consists of plant and animal residues at various stages of decomposition, cells and tissues of soil organisms, and substances synthesized by soil organisms.

label: active permafrost layer
definition: A layer which is composed of ground that is 1) subject to annual thawing and freezing and 2) present in areas underlain by permafrost.

label: soil surface layer
subClassOf [LABEL]: solid astronomical body part|surface of an astronomical body
definition: A surface layer which is composed primarily of soil.

label: bare soil surface layer
definition: A soil surface which is exposed to the troposphere, with no appreciable cover from vegetation or other material.

label: water column
definition: A liquid astronomical body part which 1) vertically spans a water body and 2) has fiat boundaries approximating a columnar shape.

label: plastisphere
definition: A part of an astronomical body which includes, as parts, all the entities which are composed primarily of plastic and which are within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body.

label: marine anthropogenic litter
definition: Anthropogenic litter which is present in the marine environment.

label: manufactured plastisphere
definition: A plastisphere which is composed primarily of manufactured plastic.

label: water table
definition: A surface layer which is 1) part of a phreatic zone in contact with a vadose zone and 2) contains interstitial water with a pressure head equal to atmospheric pressure.

label: compacted soil
definition: A soil which has a high bulk density and/or a low porosity. A compacted soil has a reduced rate of both water infiltration and drainage

label: sandy loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: silty loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: sandy clay loam
definition: Clay loam which has a high proportion of sand in its composition.

label: clay loam
definition: Loam which has a high proportion of clay in its composition.

label: silty clay loam
definition: Clay loam which has a high proportion of silt in its composition.

label: microcontinental island
definition: An island created when a continent is rifted.

label: depositional island
definition: An island formed by deposition of solid material such as sand or small rocks where a water current loses some of its carrying capacity.

label: barrier island
definition: An island formed by the accumulation of sand deposited by sea currents on a continental shelves

label: industrial wastewate treatment plant
definition: A wastewater treatment plant that treates industrial wastewater. Industrial wastewater treatment covers the mechanisms and processes used to treat waters that have been contaminated in some way by anthropogenic industrial or commercial activities prior to its release into the environment or its re-use.

label: agricultural wastewater treatment plant
definition: A wastewater treatment plant that treats agriculatural wastewater. Agricultural wastewater treatment relates to the treatment of wastewaters produced in the course of agricultural activities. Agriculture is a highly intensified industry in many parts of the world, producing a range of wastewaters requiring a variety of treatment technologies and management practices.

label: algal bloom
definition: A feature that arises from a rapid increase or accumulation in the population of algae (typically microscopic) in an aquatic system.

label: freshwater algal bloom
definition: An algal bloom that is located in freshwater. Freshwater algal blooms are the result of an excess of nutrients, particularly some phosphates.

label: fossil fuel power plant
definition: A power station which burns a fossil fuel such as coal, natural gas, or petroleum to produce electricity.
